title: A must visit if you are going for the 1st time
review: Robber's cave is a river cave naturalally formed that has river water flowing from the middle of a cave. This place is around 9 kms from Dehradun Clock tower. This tour involves a kilometer of trekking to reach the place which makes it somewhat adventurous and thrilling. This is a perfect picnic spot if going with your family. Must go once...

title: Better than what the name explains.
review: Hmmm. First impression is like... is someone making a gucchu of me!! Na.. But its far more beautiful that what the name explains. During the way.. It feels what could be in the back of these village roads..Lonely..with no sign boards.. Etc. But No... Its really good & its not lonely at the cave and its one of its kind. Place is not so developed but its raw as it could be long ago and that's the charm of it. Its a no miss if in Dehradun. Falling water is clear and fresh.

title: Must visit
review: Robbers cave is a river cave naturally formed that has river water flowing from the middle of cave. It is a must visit place if u are travelling to dehradun.

title: Fantastic walk in knee-deep water through cavernous surroundings
review: The Robber's Cave or Gucchu Paani in local terminology is a fabulous cave formation with water flowing through in the middle. The knee deep water is cool and the surroundings have a calming effect on visitors. While the more adventurous ones seek to climb atop the rock formations at the farther end, the walk is through the meandering rock formations is thrilling especially for children who will love every moment of the time spent in the cave. We were lucky enough to spot an owl perched on a treetop during our visit and giving us curious glances.A must visit in Dehradun!

title: Exhilarating Experience
review: It's truly a different kind and an unique experience. It's a cave or a gap between 2 rocks, with water flowing downstream. You have to wade in this shin deep cold water against the tide to explore this cave, which is not very deep. You can go into the cave one way and exit another way which brings you back near to the place you started. At the entrance to the cave there are touts who for Rs10/-, will ask you to deposit your footwear and give you a pair of slippers to wade into the water, which on your return, you can return and collect your own footwear deposited with them. This place is on the outskirts of Dehradun on the road to Musoorie, so you have to engage personal transportation to reach here. But on getting here you will enjoy the experience. As you will be walking against the tide, it might tire you out if you are on the elderly side. During the winter months the water is quite chill initially, but after some time you will get used to it. An experience not to be missed.

title: Must visit in Dehradun
review: Approach: The cave is around 12 kms from city towards Mussoorie road. Better to take a rental cab or an auto since it us away from the main street and you might need to walk to get a ride back to Dehradun.

title: Good time
review: Had a good time, plan your visit for 60-90 mins, carry slippers as getting into cave with 1feet water is adviced.

title: Over Crowded
review: There were times when this place used to be a calm and nice place to visit but nowadays this is so populated and dirty as well.

title: Super fun
review: The place was super fun. You walk through the water through a narrow lane with mountain walls on both sides. The place is little crowded (not as crowded as the city), but it is a must visit. You can go in a long way. There is canteen arrow which you can follow from where the majority people return back. This takes you in, where there are tables set in the middle of the water and cave. Must go till the end.

title: Nature at its best
review: Its a beautiful place with water flowing between two mountains... neat clean clear water... waterfall towards end... nice place with few eating restaurants nearby..

title: Must visit when in Dehradun
review: I was a little skeptical to go inside first but never regretted going ahead. You can hire flip flops at INR 10 per person near the counter if you do not wish to wet your footwear. They also offer water wear on rent but we did not hire them as we were wary of the hygiene. Walk all the way till the end where the waterfall actually originates. it's awesome experience

title: nice attraction for hot days
review: walking in water through the open roof cave is a refreshing attraction for hot days. the water can reach almost waist level so make sure to keep valuables in a dry pack and bring change trousers, you will need them. though there are flip flops to rent outside the cave we found the current too strong to walk in them and would recommend walking barefoot or with sandals only.

title: Different
review: Ive bee here many times .This trip that I made was after more than 15 years.I was disappointed to see the shabby shops all around the place.Irrespective of that,Its a must see place for those that have not been there.Walking between the cliffs towards the cave is a nice unique experience.

title: Its different feel
review: You all must have visited rivers or cave but when fresh cold water touches your feet and you walk to for hundred meters inside a cave it altogether a different experience.

title: Must Visit place in dehradun
review: Its a natural beauty. Water flowing from caves. 15-30min walk in cave through water at your knee level. clean chilled water will run through your legs.

title: The water coming through hills
review: People who want to take a small slice of the adventure.... Keep waking through narrow road in between the hills in bear feet through the water.  It's fun to go through the water but be little careful while coming back. Talk till the end to enjoy the surprise.

title: Good place to have adventure
review: Good place if you need adventure  ,  previously it dont have any ticket but now ticket is levied(50/person)  but yes best place, good adventure, safe, try to visit till top of the same.

title: Don't miss!
review: It is an unique experience entering the flowing water stream through the steep rock face on both sides.

title: AWESOME
review: If you are in Dehradun you must visit here. Adults and children can equally enjoy this, a kind of a trek in shallow waters through a narrow cave. You can spend around 1hr 30 mins if you are a small family. Rs. 25 is the entry fees. Food stalls here are not of high standards at the most you can get some maggi or momos so if you have small children do feed them before u get here. Fun place. Cleanliness could have been better.

title: Pristine location
review: Had a nominal fees for entry,had to walk half a km through water between the rocky projections

title: Nice natural cave feeling, nice walking barefoot on the stones!
review: Knee length water level! you can enjoy walking in water. Crystal clear water is a real treat!  You can walk miles together and enjoy a wild walk!

title: Walking on the Stones !!
review: It’s one of the most visited place in town for tourists specially in summer time. The walk through the cave is a fun experience with the small waterfall at the end of the cave .

title: Loved the experience!
review: Most visited place in dehradun for tourists. The walk through the cave is a fun experience with the small waterfall at the end of the cave .

title: Superb place
review: Its a Creek between two small hills. If you visit dehradun, don't miss it. It's a very unique experience.

title: One day outing from Dehradun
review: Great place to visit with family. Comfortable footwear recommended. Bathroom slippers available however its fun going without any footwear.

title: A great place to hangout
review: This place has a sense of adventure, a cave and flowing waters. However it will be very crowded with tourists and noisy. So go and explore the cave and then find your little spot where you can immerse your feet in flowing water and enjoy.

title: Excellent place to chill with friends & family
review: Excellent place to chill with friends & family

title: Water between 2 rocks
review: Let me commend the authorities to make a famous tourist attraction out of this average cave. This cave is hardly 200 mtrs where water comes out between two huge rocks and you can walk inside with water till knee length. We went at morning 7 am so there was absolutely zero crowd and hence it was nice.

title: Robbers Cave - Flowing Cold Water
review: This give in is not really 200 mtrs where water turns out between two enormous rocks and you can stroll inside with water till knee length. It was a solo trip to this place, i went around 9 am and absolutely there was no crowd and it was a nice visit. Please be cautious while walking in the water to reach the cave. Footwear may get washed away in the water.

title: This Robber stole my heart.
review: The place is heaven on Earth. The chilling water warmed my heart. Very pleasant place. I was thrilled when I saw skin of snake at the corner so be careful especially while taking children.. I advice people to stop throwing plastics, that ruins beauty of nature.

title: one of its kind
review: Visited on rainy day (drizzling), place was amazing as you through water into cave . we were lucky after spending couple of hours there and returned, we found out  visit was put on hold there was heavy downpour and there were of chance of heavy gush from upstream , so on a rainy day , plan cautiously and do carry extra clothes...as one is certainly sure to get drenched

title: Should be on your itinerary list
review: The first time I visited this place I was amazed to see this place. It feels really good walking on the water inside a cave it gives you a feel of something different. I first visited this place in off season so it was an amazing experience but next time I visited it in month of May and it was very crowded, still must visit. And to make it even a better experience there is one tea and maggi stall at the end of the cave, you will have to climb a little, sit there drink tea eat maggi and just enjoy the moment.

title: My first Solo visit
review: An offbeat place where you have to walk in a knee deep chilled water between a serpentine crater.It is a cave which is 200 meters long and at the extreme end is a waterfall. Accessible in the winter months.You have to hire a slipper from the various store for Rs 10.Lot of eating options are there.The place is 10 Kilometers from the city centre and falls on the road from Dehradun to Mussoorie.

title: Beautiful Place with Much Greenery.
review: It  was a good trip around. Gucchu pani seems one of nice place stay on. Twice been here. Government has taken good initiative to clean it and maintained its beauty. Its rainy season so water level bit high. But enjoyable. Sleeper swings away while walking. Cave high up with full of rocks inner core. Amazing when you see water drops comes ur head shoulders makes you the presence of the place.

title: Water Cave
review: It is amazing place to visit. You have to go through running  cold water upto the end. There is small cafe on top at the end where you can get tea with snacks.

title: Very nice water cave
review: This river cave is also known as the gucchu pani. This is famous for water falls, nature and photography. It is a 600 metre long cave.

title: Nice experience
review: If you want to visit a place which is adventerous, then it's a perfect spot. The water is up to the knees and you have to walk in the mid of the two rocky mountains. There's also waterfalls to bath in. It's a fabulous place for youngsters. Clothes and footwear are available there

title: Perfect location for those seeking adventure and thrill
review: Robber's Cave (locals call it  Guchhupani), is one of the must visit popular tourist attraction in Dehradun. It is located near Sahasradhara (another tourist place) and approximately 8 km from the city centre of Dehradun. It is a natural cave formation where rivers flows inside the cave. Perfect location for those seeking adventure and thrill.

title: Natural water cave with nice experience
review: Cave high up with full of rocks inner core. Amazing when you see water drops comes ur head shoulders makes you the presence of the place. This river cave is also known as the gucchu pani. This is famous for water falls, nature and photography. It is a long cave. which is adventerous, then it's a perfect spot. The water is up to the knees and you have to walk in the mid of the two rocky mountains.

title: Awesome place
review: Awesome place must visit this place kids like this place.must go with your family and friends I am very very happy

title: A bit of a disappointment
review: The place has like many other spots turned into a commercialized zone and has lost its typical beauty.

title: A beautiful combination of Waterfall and Caves
review: Robber's cave also known as Gucchupani is one of the fav destination to visit in Dehradun. A water stream running on a narrow path in mid of the rocks. At end, you will see a waterfall which makes this location more mesmerizing. Food court is available here where you can get couple of shopping selling maggie, momos, tea and etc. Lockers, changing faclility is available in the location. Also, there is a small fun park for kids where they can enjoy couple of rides. Overall a good experience.

title: A MUST MUST DO
review: When we enetered the place , it dint look that appealing to me .You have to open your footwear and rent rubber chappals from hawkers(DO IT).and then a short walk will lead you to paradise .Beautiful caves with above ankle length water to walk through with water dripping from some ends and sunlight coming from others .You will just keep taking pictures , its so pretty .A must do when in Dehradun or mussorie, as it falls in between the way .Feels like you are in some exotic natural place

title: A must see attraction in Dehradun
review: Robbers cave is a must see attraction in Dehradun. They are open till 7 PM but it is recommended to go there with ample day light. The cave is full of water so please wear shorts and slippers as shoes will get wet.

title: Robbers Cave Visit with Family
review: Very crowded on Thursday, 22nd June. Not at all recommended if you are not OK with huge crowds,  Mela type environment and have fear of stampedes

title: Interesting
review: If you are in Dehradun, you must visit this place. Walking in the clod water is an experience itself. Then you can take bath under the fall.

title: Natural beauty
review: Natural caves with knee deep water at places. Its better tk carry own slippers and shorts. Best time to visit is early morning.

title: It has become too congested and dirty
review: Have been here multiple times but this time major disappointment. It has become too commercial and too dirty. Did not felt like stepping into the stream. Too drty with all kinds of folks venturing into the same.

title: Never Miss...........
review: You will love, if you are a nature enthusiast. Be ready for a treak. Keep some spare dress, you need to be wet to have the beauty of Gucchu Pani.You will love, if you are a nature enthusiast. Be ready for a treak. Keep some spare dress, you need to be wet to have the beauty of Gucchu Pani.

title: Nice water place to visit during summers
review: Overall nice experience. Whenever I visit doon during summers, I try to take out time to visit here with friends or family members. The water runs through the area surrounded by hill walls from both the sides creating an impression of a cave. Deep further inside, there is a water cave and also one can go to the top to enjoy. Good place to beat the summer heat at Doon.

title: Guuuchu pani miss u
review: Nice place enjoyed a lot in water chill Water it was raining heavy at masoori so water level was about to increase Ss our guide instructions.

title: Exciting visit
review: When in Dehradun,this place should be in ur must visit place. Make sure to arrange to and fro transport. It's kinda on d outskirts so public transport is negligible. We hired a two wheeler n had an amazing trip. Roads are quite safe. Once u reach there, take d slippers available for rent of 10bucks. Take from near d gate or inside d gate. There's an entry ticket for d cave. Either wear shorts itself n go here or there's changing rooms also here but women won't be comfortable changing here. I had very high expectations from d place though they were not met, we still had a very good time. Since it's an actual cave, waterfalls from anywhere, cold water made d trip thrilling. After reaching d end u can climb up d hill n have another exciting journey uphill, we didn't do that, found it too risky. Come out n have some tea for sure. Click lots of pics

title: Awesome Place To Visit
review: If u r in a group and looking for some great places to visit in Dehradun. Robbers Cave would be a great option for you.

title: Awesome place to visit
review: If you are visiting Dehradun, make sure that you are not missing this place. This is a wonderful place, especially in summer. This is a natural cave formation and within that a river with real cold water is flowing down. At the other end, there is a waterfall. The water level reaches at around knee level at some sections of the cave path, so wear cloths accordingly. But, the walk through the water is really amazing.

title: Wonderful experience
review: This is an amazing place. Pls wear chappals if u don't like to wear second hand chappals. Wear shorts if possible or at least a three fourth. Carry extra clothes especially if u have kids with u. Forget all ur worries n just enjoy nature here

title: Beautiful
review: Many people will tell you not to visit this place. The place is dirty. Not that fun. Don't listen to them and visit the place. I visited this place last weekend and i like it pretty much. You are welcomed with knee level water. So wear your shorts and chappals to avoid injuries. If you're with your family then you'll move further and start playing in the water. If you like trekking and adventure then you can go ahead in the cave and you'll find waterfall at multiple places. I loved the place.

title: Gucchupani
review: Visit this place ....Feel natural beauty

title: Place is too much hype
review: Heard much about this place. Hence decided to pay a visit.

title: Natural Beauty
review: This was the first place we visited, they charge 50 rs per person. This is natural cave having a waterfall. The place is not clean though but one can enjoy the natural cave with water.

title: Dont miss the robbers cave. Its worth going
review: We went on 11.04.2018 and the water level was just above knee level and very exciting and enjoyable. As there not much options for sightseeing in Dehradun city. It's a good to go place for family as well as others. It's a walkway between two big rocks with a nice flow of cold and cold and cold water. Go out and enjoy. It's worthy.

title: Experienced cave river walk.
review: Visit during day time so that you can cover entire cave walk. We went in the evening so was able to walk half of it.

title: Best nature guarded place.
review: The cave has crazy exploration adventurous hills from which water falls. But the local legendary stories does make it interesting. Also has some junks eating points.

title: Cool place to explore
review: Robber's cave is one of the interesting place in Mussoorie with its many exciting stories. The walk is very interesting as the water keep rising as your proceed towards the cave and dont forget to wear the shorts. Overall very cool, exciting and worth palce to visit.

title: A natural cave that can rob your time....so beautiful to explore
review: It was also a suddenly picked up point to avoid the class when I was in IIT Roorkee. we the group of 4 boys took the bus from roorkee to dehradun after had our breakfast & then by auto from dehradun to robber's cave. after that small walking of 5-7 mins to the cave. at first sight it is nothing attractive from outside. just a small "jharoha" is flowing down & people walk on it, some tea stalls beside it, one blackish mouth of cave. thats it. but as we stand in front of that cave's mouth we can feel a different sensation. we strolled through the rocks stand beside & the chilled water came upto our knee height. it was just awesome to have one such place. at the end of the cave there is a waterfalls. we climb up the slippery rocks though the water & went up. it is really sensational when we sat there watching open blue sky above our head, blue water flowing below our feet, rocks stands like mountain, waterfalls through the green bush. time flies as we spent there. After our exploration we went there again with our full class & wish to go again.

title: Guchuu panni
review: An awesome place. Walking through the stream inside the cave was indeed a good experience. Feel the natural breeze and keep walking till you reach the dead end. Water is knee deep and the rocks a bit slippery at the end point so be careful. You need to take sleepers and shorts incase you want to enjoy the fall and walk thru. Weekend usually crowdy. Must visit.

title: Cool place
review: This is an interesting place to visit with the family and kids, the water level is knee deep at times and trousers will get wet. Some places to eat are available nearby.

title: Perfect Place for enjoying...
review: Find this place in Dehradun, if you want to enjoy in water. Look at the nature's beauty here..

title: Unique walk in between caves
review: A must visit place in dehradun. The place is so unique and so close to nature. A stream of water cuts through two caves to make a small passage to walk through to reach a beautiful Disneyland like waterfall.

title: Mesmerizing and Adventurous Cave
review: We ventured at this place early morning around 7:30. We covered almost half of the cave. Walking in the water, the water level went upto our knees was such fun.

title: Rocky walk
review: This is one of a kind of experience as you walk thru the cake in knee  deep water with the risk of your slippers getting away in the flowing water. Our family had lot of time hooting inside

title: wonderfull place
review: Till reaching that point was not able to judge its difference. Once should not not miss it.

title: Best place for a good trip
review: As It was holi after the throwing the color on each other we were so colorful. We painted to each other after that when we finished with color. We went to the guchu pani. One my favorite place after the shastrdhara. We went to the fall it was not so far and you can see that there are so many tourist come to this place and they really enjoy the running water coming from cave along with photography. If anyone new to dehradun must visit this place, and March April is the best time to visit this place, if you are nature lover you will definitely love it.

title: Beautiful
review: I have been frequenting Dehradun since my childhood days and have surprisingly never been here. We stumbled upon it in a leaflet in our hotel lobby and decided to make a day of it. And I am glad that we did. This is place is beautiful!

title: Cool Place
review: This place is cool as the water there makes it a perfect getaway from the sun's heat. Good place overall entry charges 25 per person

title: Surely adorable place
review: It's too thrilling funful refeshment...to visit gucchupani.  A must visit place in Dehradun.My daughter and other     elder family members equally enjoy the trip.

title: Wow...what a different kind of experience...
review: If you are looking to be next to nature with some exciting and enthralling experience....do visit this place....well maintained with a nominal Rs 25/- entry fee....do carry a pair of slippers ...otherwise you need to hire them there...as one has to walk through shallow water ...through the cave....I can bet that the experince would be better than the description....Do not miss it...

title: Must visit the place
review: Gucchu Pani is must visit place while you in Dehradun. The natural water comes out from caves looks very beautiful. The best part is you can walk in the water between the rock mountains.

title: Probably the only interesting place in Mussourie
review: If you're in Dehradun or Mussourie, you must visit this place. Even though the place doesn't offer anything extraordinary, it is definitely an interesting place to explore. This is a small cave which is a good 750 m walk inside the water.. You can take a dip in the cold water towards the end of the cave.

title: Atlast something near natural
review: It is really a nature's piece worth visiting.

title: Nature at its best !
review: While entering this place after parking your car , u won’t feel good due to the badly maintained entry and the dirty water flowing out from the cave but once u enter the cave , will be mesmerised by the sheer natural beauty inside. Enjoy the coffee / maggie at the tea joint on top.

title: Must visit in Dehradun
review: Also known as guchchi paani. You will get slippers on rent near car parking and near entrance also. Water not very cold during last week of December.

title: Mesmerizing
review: Simply Awesome. Walking on water flowing on the ground is just amazing. Idle for good trekking. Must visit.

title: Sweet and short Trek But..
review: Reached the place in Ola cabs without any discomfort. Nice place to visit and one of its kind. Had an unique experience. I suggest travelers to go early and book a 2-way transport. We faced difficulty to find transport while returning and ended in a remote place. Some kind person helped us to get back to our hotel otherwise things would be different!!

title: Must visit place in Dehradun
review: This place is approx 8-10 km from city center.  It is also famous as Guchhu Pani in locals.  You can enjoy the cold stream along with the natural beauty of caves. If you are in Dehradun I recommend visit to this place specially for families.  Children will definitely enjoy this place.  you can spend 3-4 hours here.  Entry is free.

title: Adventure rools out
review: This is spot where robbers hid. This is also a spot where you feel you are in some mystery novel. You enjoy the walk through the gushing water and the narrow rock path. The place is a natural wonder. There is an entry fee of Rs 25.

title: Picnic spot
review: Gucchu pani or Robber's cave is a must visit place at Dehradun.Easily accessible from most of the decent hotels of Dehradun .We hired an OLA rental and reached this place post lunch time .One can otherwise if moving in a bigger group can plan whole day excursion if time permits.

title: Mesmerising experience
review: This place is a perfect picnic spot and a must-visit tourist destination. It is a river cave and the water flows against you as you move inside the cave. The water level gradually increases and the water flow feels awesome. I would suggest you take a pair of slippers when you visit this spot. Also, it would be better to visit it by personal means of convenience as the connectivity is poor.

title: Cool
review: It has a history.

title: Pretty Good
review: Visited during June 2017, Nice place. good picnic spot. Enjoyed with cousins and kids. Water not much so safer place

title: Amazing cave
review: Must visit in Dehradun, nice natural water flowing, i visited in June when the water level was not much, still enjoyed.

title: Different rxperience
review: This walk through water in a cave is different experience. The water is very clean and the walk is long. Slippers is recommended and is available on rent... other wise stones will hurt

title: Good Place to visit...
review: Nice and peaceful place.... not too much water too... if u visit this place, dont forget to go inside the cave till the last point... there is also a cable car to take to a temple up on the hill....

title: Amazing Beauty of The place
review: Enjoyed All time Visitable Place. Amazing experience visiting there , We Could see the beauty of nature. We had to walk through water between two mountains and at the end We could be seeing a waterfall. Hooting and cheering inside the cave is common and it could surely energise us. At some points water could be be upto our knee and we could be amazed. Nice Experience.

title: Great Place
review: A must visit place. My experience was awesome, we all wants to go this place again. its near from Dehradun Station and transport communication is also very convenient.

title: Good place to visit
review: Actually a good place to visit have natural water, have rarely seen such places might be. Needs more maintenance work

title: Peaceful cold atmosphere
review: Beautiful nature at its best in the Robber's cave. Crystal clear water and peaceful place with cold atmosphere.

title: Romantic place
review: Nice place to visit with your partner.. Cold water running beneath feet.. Lockers available for keeping luggage.. Small restro for tea and snacks..

title: nice place for a picnic
review: well maintained, clean great place to chill with a lot of facility, lot of tea shops available, lots of freshly prepared tasty snacks

title: Thrilling Experiance.... Must Visit Place
review: It is one of the best place I have been to........ wlaking in flowing water is an exciting experience...... But suggest to go there in regular pubic hours as you will feel lonely and place will seems to be scary if people are not around you...

title: A place for walking
review: Although I haven't reached the final destination inside the cave, I din't find it a must place to visit. Walk through the natural canal (cold water) in between the rocks. May worth some time to visit if you want to see the nature from very near but you may be disappointed to see no any major attraction at the end.

title: Awesome
review: A little adventurous and much romantic place. Natural beauty of this place is very rare. Unforgettable experience.

title: Robbers Cave...Just the *Perfect *Location on a hot day
review: Given the late departure of this years Monsoon I was pleased to find that the water level in the Cave was overall just above ankle depth, though fast flowing as usual. I was wearing my TeeVaas, so no need to rent flip flops.  My footwear was far more secure and reassuring than what I would have found with the Flipflop's.  the cave has its name originate from a place supposedly used by a Robber... one can find info about this elsewhere on the Web. The 5-10  minute walk into the Cave, which is really an Upriver Direction, winds itself through a narrow gorge erouded out over the years by the river. Near  the end you can continue on by climbing carefully up over the smooth rocks protruding from the sides. Eventually you arrive at the remnants of a stone wall, below which you can access if you are inclined for a shower.. no extra 25rupees charge for this.  Today some school girls were taking advantage of this free shower though not sure how they would manage the soaked uniforms on exiting the Cave.  I found the excursion to be extremely satisfying especially so my feet and now very clean T-Vaas' . Definitely this should be on your list to visit.

title: best in Doon
review: one of the best things to do io you are in dehradun.Trip advisors show it if free of cost, but please note that there is entry charges of INR 25/-  and from upwards its 900 meters below, can be walked as well as cars come here ( parking is additional)

title: Water walk
review: One of the adventures I have recently visited .

title: Robber feeling
review: A must visit place in dehradun and a completely different experience. Cold waters rushing out of the cave and you have to walk about a km against the stream inside the cave.

title: Not what we expected!
review: We headed down to Robber’s Cave as it was recommended as a must-see spot. Unfortunately we visited on a Sunday and being the weekend, it was super busy and crowded. Lots of people were having water fights and splashing around in the water so it wasn’t the tranquil experience we were expecting!

title: Interesting  natural cave formation with free flowing chilled cold water streams
review: Advised to visit under adult supervision as this is a bit risky adventurous place to visit when going with children. We have to wade through knee deep water gushing from the narrow caves shaped formation, due to proximity of 2 mountains. Tread carefully on a clear day & avoid during monsoon or rains

title: Amazing fun place..
review: This is an exciting place in dehradun.. A must visit. It mysterious to find the water coming from Beneath 2 close mountains.. As you go inside the water level reaches the knee level and you also find a slight drizzle over the head.. a cool waterfall over your head. The ambience is nice. You will find the waterfall behind the mountain and click pictures inside. Sit outside this place and relax beside the water flow. :)

title: hyped up
review: more of a picnic spot rather than a place of tourist importance. opening your shoes and taking yourself for a ride. avoid it

title: Splendid cool tunnel
review: One of the not-to-be missed places in Dehradun. Please go during broad day light. Wear the hired footwear and watch your step. Advised to wear short trousers and keep some change clothes. The place is amazing

title: Good Place For Summer vacations
review: I came here for business tour but one day I went to Robers cave it is amazing really good for Summer I feel their relax their is lots of cave with water fall Good one

title: Adventurous place for water lovers with full of natural beauty.
review: Its an amazing place if you love adventure and are fond of water. Must carry things like water costumes so that easily enjoy in water. This place is surrounded by a cave and the water flow cannot be gauged as it comes from an upward point or mountains.

title: Monsoons need caution
review: The area around Gucchu pani has many temples and evokes the local flavour and feels exactly like semi hill stations in India feel like.

title: Good to enjoy with family
review: Gucchu Pani also known as Robbers Cave also. Paid parking facility is available is here. You can take slippers on rent, they charge Rs. 10 per pair. Lots of food stalls are also there. you can enjoy bathing if you want to. To be visited during rainy season.

title: Excellent to wade through in summers
review: I was there in winter time and the water was cold.  You should carry your own rubber slippers to walk in the water if you don't like to rent it on the spot.  I just wish it was more clean and people did not destroy this beautiful spot.  Beware of snakes in water too.

title: Awesome experience in the caves
review: This place is a must when in Dehradun. The caves lead to a water fall. At many places within the caves, you need to bend to move one. The place is a natural beauty.

title: Nice place
review: We went there when there was a very high flow of water, enjoyed a lot, a. Ice place to hangout for sometime, if you are short of time you can skip this place

title: good for summers
review: after mussoorie trip we stayed dehradoon 2 days. Gucchu Pani also known as Robbers Cave also. Its an amazing place if you love adventure and are fond of water.it is a good picnic spot with kids

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Resently visited this wonderful hotel surrounded by beautiful nature.  I'm fully satisfied in terms of facilities, ambiance, restaurant and cleanliness..

title: Experience the nature in minutes
review: I heard about this place years back but didn't got the chance to be there. While planing for my Mussoorie trip, I have decided to include it in my itinerary. While returning back from Mussoorie, we visited this place. It is more beautiful and adventurous than what i have expected. it is a long passage covered with hilly rock / wall from both sides giving it a feel of tunnel. Water flows through it in which you can easily walk. at couple of meters it can reach up to thigh level. It is a nice experience to walk to and fro to this passage. I suggest to visit this place on weekdays and towards weekend it is maddening rush. There are few shops in the vicinity that provides snacks, maggi, soft drinks, tea etc. that you can enjoy. Must visit place, do include it in your itinerary while palning a trip to Dehradun or Mussoorie.

title: SUPHUR WATER CAVES
review: nothing as gupchup paani or robber's cave these caves are famous for sulphur water providing a cure for most of the skin diseases. nice place affordable food and stay people are very helpful overall a nice place to visit

title: Average place for visit
review: I will say only an average place. Lot of traffic in the roads. It is not advisable to visit with the kids as there is a running water.

title: Its heyday is gone
review: This used to be a lovely picnic spot but now it is really crowded and often very dirty as well. Too much commercialisation has reduced this once excellent spot to mediocrity.

title: A lil rock climbing
review: If you are a person who loves to walk in the river n enjoy exploring a cave then this is the place for you

title: Beautiful and Natural place
review: Natural view and tooo relaxation point. in dehradun take a lots of pictures there. and enjoyed. the experience was tooo good and we were very happy there......

title: Romantic place
review: Very romantic cool place, value for money, nice surrounding with nice facilities. Food is good but little bit far from Dehradun city. This place can be visited twice - thrice, very nice place, romantic and cool place, even family will enjoy the place.

title: Kids enjoy such places
review: Kids certainly enjoy such places where they can roam around putting there feet in water and enjoy. Crowd depends but they do have a lot of people and usually overcrowded. It's actually a drive from main road

title: Great place, Must visit
review: It is fun to walk into the caves in knee length water. However the entrance was dirty with people throwing trash all over after eating. Guess they should ban plastics and any food in plastics at this place to retain its charm.

title: The best sightseen in dalhousie
review: It is the best sightseen place in dalhousie.You have to pay rs.25 for a single person to entry and rs.30 for the car.A good palce near the pacific mall just 2km far from the mall.It is very beautiful place.Their were many shops selling maggie and hot coffee.The cave was awesome with the flow of water.Best sightseen in the dalhousie.

title: Adventurous place
review: People who goes to Dehradun to travel must visit this place also. There are some rock climbing inside the cave and go forward as you can, more you go inside, you will find more attraction. This cave is around 1 KM long. Then you'll reach at the starting point of it.

title: Fine water place to visit during summer
review: It's a public place. During summer it is usually crowded. You can go there, sit and enjoy. There is nothing much to do. It is a cave in which a river is flowing. When you go inside you can also see a fall. Kids like such places. It not very preferred to go on a rainy day because water flow can increase.

title: An awesome place with waist height water
review: One of the attractions in Dehradun. Really nice. You have to cross the cave with waist length water, so wear short clothes. A must visit.

title: Natural Beauty Spoilt by humans
review: Robber's Cave was one of the must visit places on our Dehradun trip. Since, we walked up to the place it was tiring for us, so we sat on the rocks submerging our feet in the ice cold water which was very relaxing for us.

title: Mysterious
review: Robbers cave has access upto about 200 M inside with water flowing over which you have to ford through. At the end is a waterfall. Good experience, especially for children.

title: Beautiful place
review: Everyone who visits Dehradun should make it to this place. Leave your footwear in your car or bike, and hire the footwear for this purpose. It's a cool place, would love to visit it in Winter once.

title: Decent place to spend time with your family
review: Robbers cave is about 14kms from Dehradun. It has caves and cold water running thru the surface. Good experience to walk in wait deep water but during peak season there is too much crowd and hence you may not enjoy the place.

title: Water and cave
review: Not much to see here but walking down the caves filled with a feet water was a different experience. Authorities should think of doing more with the available resources for tourist to enjoy more.

title: Not worth visiting
review: This is a very famous tourist spot in Dehradun but when you visit the place you will not find it so attractive.

title: Hidden gem
review: Really nice place to visit on your trip to dehradun. Wear floaters or plastic slippers to walk comfortably in the water. It gets pretty hot in the afternoon so best to visit in the morning or evening.

title: Interesting outing
review: nice place but very crowded, unkept, very very crowded. cant enjoy the beauty or the uniqueness. Typical hill station Maggi, MoMo fare available.

title: Amazing
review: Don't be scared....enter the caves. Its safe and wonderful. We traveled with kids and elders. Only the last little part is difficult where elderly people find difficulty, they can wait while the others visit the last waterfall and come. Overall memorable for people of all ages.

title: Great place to visit.
review: A visit to this place with family or friends is a great experience. Natural caves with water flowing looks impeccable.

title: Adventurous !
review: We visited this place recently. While we visited, we were supposed to wear rubber shoes . There is seperate stall for rubber shoes . We had to walk into cave inside. It is full of water . Walking into the water , we found a waterfall inside . Truly Adventurous ! Must visit !

title: Serendipity
review: I have passed through Dehradun so many  times but never explored. This place is a total find! It is a hidden cave with a small waterfall and you get to it by walking in ankle deep cool water through a ravine/gorge. There are unexpected twists and turns opening up wonderful vistas, and the water temperature varies as you walk. Quite clean and it wasn't very crowded when we went. I can imagine it getting claustrophobic if there are too many people. You can rent rubber flip flops for Rs 10 at the entrance. Strongly recommended.

title: Crowd ruined it
review: I have rated it 3 star because everyone else was rated it 5 star otherwise i would have rated it 2 star.

title: Hopeless crowd and badly maintained
review: I had visited this place 5 years back and it was one of the best places in Dehradun. But unfortunately, now this place has been commercialized. People flock this place - eat and throw the garbage in the cave. I couldnt stay in this place for more than 5 mins, some rowdy group of people was there, who were shouting, pushing and splashing water on people. Just very disappointed at the state of this place. I will highly discourage to go to this place.

title: Robbers Cave
review: Guchuchu phani or Robbers Cave is known for unusual cold springs which goes underground at some of the places inside the Cave. This is one of my favourite place.

title: Wow
review: What a place.  If you are visiting Dehradun or Mussoorie you must visit this place.  This is so beautiful you can spend hours on this place.

title: NEVER TO MISS ATTRACTION IN DEHRADUN
review: its very good place to visit or i say never to miss attraction in DEHRADUN

title: Must visit place when at Dehradun
review: The 600 meters long river cave (Robber’s Cave) is known by the locals as Gucchupani. The cave is divided into two main parts with its highest fall being 10 meters long. The place is known for its unique natural phenomenon known as the disappearing stream. The place was believed to be used by the robbers to hide during the British Raj hence owing to its name.

title: Robbers' Cave, Dehradun
review: A surprise in a place like Dehradun. It is a cleft in the rock and water oozes from the rocks to create a shallow pool of clear and cool water.

title: Awesome Place to spend time
review: An awesome place in Dehradun, its a very long cave with water till you toe height only, you enjoy walking and at the end you will find a wall. Its s a much watch place if you visit dehradun.

title: Fasinating nature
review: Its a place to feel nature. You move in water deep in the cave and feel the beauty of nature. An ideal place for all nature lovers

title: Must See
review: It's a must see attraction of Dehradun. Long back it was a robber's hideout, now a tourist attraction. Between two rocky mountains, there's a stream of water continuously flowing. Walking in this cold water for a long distance is a lot of fun.At the end there's a wall. The water just covers our feet, but the bed of the stream is covered with sharp stones. So better don't walk barefoot. Slippers are available for a nominal fee at several of the counters nearby.

title: Amazing experiance at Rober's cave
review: Very nice place to visit specially for children. Very big natural caver and good water flow under your feet. At some places it's deep too. Easily you can spend 4-5 hours and enjoy maggi outside cave.

title: Nice Place to be with Your Friends
review: Robbers Cave is really a fun place to be with you friends. Lot of young boys and girls come here to enjoy which adds to this attraction. Water flows into the cave from outside at a height of 10mtrs only this is the point where you can enjoy the bath. From this point water goes on to flow between two wall shapes mountains. Water level is upto the knee level inside cave.

title: Must see place
review: This is a very interesting place. Its basically 2 huge rocks forming a cave. There's water flowing inside the cave. You will enjoy walking on the water while watching the beauty of the rocks. You definitely need to carry slippers for walking on the water. There are pebbles under the water. At the end of the rock, there's a small waterfall.

title: Mr navpreet singh bhatia
review: Robber's cave is a great place to visit in dehradun.... the place is very scary but adventurous, this is one of its own kind, visit the place before 6pm....

title: Forgotten and neglected
review: If one looks up for weekend getaways from Dehradoon Robbers Cave is sure to crop up.

title: Rare beauty of Nature
review: Clean flowing water within the caves... A bit crowded but nice place to visit in Dehradun.. This area is although underdeveloped.. Could be enhanced as a better tourist place...

title: An attraction never to be missed
review: We visited Robbers cave on the last leg of our Uttarakhand trip.  It was really a thrilling experience to walk through the Stream. water comes out from the  rocks on either side.

title: Visit during summers
review: Visit in Summer and winters but prefer in summers not during winters good place to see when you are in Dehradun must visit

title: Beautiful place spoiled by Tourists
review: It is a beautiful stream of water flowing between 2 rocky hills. We reached here as we walked down the hill on a dust path and reached the stream within 5 minutes. The stream flows slowly in between the two cliffs. Its a beautiful tranquil place.

title: A bit dismal and lots of rubbish in the river
review: Admittedly it was raining when I arrived by taxi at Robbers Cave, but it was not what I expected.  I didn't walk right down to the cave area as it was slippery and there was a lack of handrails.  I was disappointed at the amount of rubbish littering the river banks.  Not what a tourist wants to see in an area which is meant to be a tourist attraction.  On the whole I'd say don't bother with this place.  I must say though that the drive into the place was quite interesting and went through an obviously wealthy area judging by the rather grand homes.

title: Can be avoided
review: We had heard alot about this place. But it was a nuisance, over crowded and filled with couples running here and there. There is nothing special in this place, only a small water body flowing out of a cave. It our waste of time.

title: Average rated attraction.
review: Good place, one time visit place.

title: Never seen before place
review: What a place man! The place belongs to the robbers in the earlier time. Now a tourist place. Try food in the outside area with the chairs and tables in the cold water and enjoy having food. A great experience.

title: Keep walking and it gets better
review: The entrance was crowded - but we went there on a Sunday so. There's also multiple snack corners if you get hungry/thirsty.

title: Hang out place
review: View is good. Generally young generation people go. Not to go with family I suggest. Hang out place.

title: Must go place
review: Clean water coming through the beautiful caves. It's a must go place in Dehradun. Also, check with the locals about the restaurant situated on the top of the cave. And if you can, should go for that also.

title: Sumthing Different
review: A very different place to see.. flowing river surrounding caves.. a small waterfall in the end.. bt has not been maintained by authorities. Actually tourists and locals visiting there are themselves making it dirty by throwing garbage into the river. Management should keep a check on dis and I suggest to tk a fine from such people who r ruining such a beautiful place

title: good
review: it was great experience to be there.

title: A different and unusual experience
review: Loved being here. Enjoyed a lot in the small water falls inside the cave with the large group of friends. Visited in autumn so a perfect time to visit here in my opinion. The vegetable maggi was just amazing after coming out of the cave. You must wear a strong hold footwear to avoid losing it.

title: Must watch place
review: Heaven on Earth. Personally I love this place. It's a Khul ja SIM SIM place.  Ancient times robbers used to hide in this place. Hill broken into two parts and has water in between. And then a small fountain.

title: Definitely different
review: It was beyond our expectations. Getting there was little tricky. So we struck a deal with local auto. Keep on walking through the cave, it gets interesting. We managed to reach the end of the cave :) Time well spent.

title: Best attraction of Dehradun
review: I simply love this place n always visit it whenever i travel to Dehradun... about half km walk through the flowing water surrounded by mountains...at the end u will find a waterfall... there are also plenty of stalls where u can enjoy snacks like maggie, omellte, momos, chowmein, chips, cold drink, chai, coffee etc..

title: A Walk In Water Cave of Mother Nature
review: As an attraction, this location has seen much needed improvement since coming under the jurisdiction of the state government.  The increase in numbers of visitors would certainly support the merits of the improvements that have been a result thereof.  As I understand it the cave got its name as being the hideaway many years ago for some local robber.  The student of geology would recognize the revealed conglomerate limestone laid bare by the action of the river.  There are facilities to store your foot ware, etc, if needed.  I opted for being barefooted but took a pair flip flops along as well as i have been here perviously. It is quite safe to wade up the gorge with the steep walls on either side. Towards the end you can climb up, being careful, to view what is a portion of a former wall, some say a  'fort wall'.  The usefulness of Interpretation Board with specifics is always helpful for visitors.  Join the group, go get your feet wet, enjoy the wade.

title: Peaceful
review: Great place to visit ,one must carry bathroom sleepers though they are available  on rent too ... N must carry nickers/shorts ..as one has to walk through the river .

title: Nice place but a bit polluted
review: This was my second visit to Guchupani and this time it was not raining.So water levels were lower than expected i.e. upto heels.When I started entering the cave,the jaaaaaaaaaaaaa started rising but the level was never above my knees.Initially there were floating plastics and bottles but the water was less polluted as I went in the cave.Hawai Chappals or slippers are a better means to walk in the cave and they are available on rent here.This place can be visited during a hot day but it is not a very good idea to have a bath here.

title: One time visit place
review: If you are  going to stay for 1 or more days in dehradun and you have some time then you should visit this play. One should not specially goto visit this place. There is a small cave and you can walk into cave. In summer there is more water in cave. Walk is about 15min for both sidw

title: Must Go Place!
review: I wanted to be selfish and didn't want to write a review as somewhere in my heart I don't want too many people to go there and pollute this beautiful hidden gem.

title: Amazing for summer
review: During summer session it could be very enjoyable spot for all friends and family, even we can do enjoy nearby swimming pool, where we can enjoy family piknik

title: Picnic Spot
review: Ample parking space with the local population taking control of little businesses like rental flip-flops and snacks counters.

title: Summer Fun !
review: If you are in Dehradun and that also in summers you have to visit Gucchu Pani. These are like two mountains separated by a river current. You have to go inside the mountains against the river currents and enjoy the refreshing water. Walking inside you will come by a place where the water falls from the top of the mountain and it looks as if it is raining. It is a perfect location to have some summer fun.

title: Must Go Places
review: This is a must go place. It is just beautiful. The last time when we went to Dehradun, we had somehow missed this point.

title: Unknown amazing little cave
review: This is a great place for friends and youngsters, though I feel children and elderly must be careful. There is water inside the cave and it is best to wear shorts and slippers. Good picnic spot.

title: Sight-seeing
review: This is a great walk on a warm day through clean, clear water with varying views as you proceed up the trail.

title: Very scenic view and cave with water
review: Robber's Cave, located at a distance of 8 km from the city centre, is one of the most popular picnic spots of the destination. Popularly known as Guchu Pani, this place is situated at a distance of 1 km from the village of Anarwala. The place is famous for a strange phenomenon, wherein a stream of water suddenly disappears from the sight and appears again after few metres.

title: Must visit
review: This is a must visit place if you are in doon! Looks like the Indian version of Great Canyon! ;) Very good photo sopt.

title: Nice cave but needs better management
review: We went to ddun during summers and were very tired roaming around in the heat, so visiting here was the right thing to do. The cave is small but beautiful and if you are ok with getting wet, it will be fun!

title: Natural cave and natural fall. Must avoid during monsoons.. ...
review: Seneic beauty is soothing. It's natural cave with natural tuning water.

title: Enjoy & Enjoy & Maggi
review: I have been here a couple of times, with kids & with friends.

title: Must visit
review: Had a great experience being there. The atmosphere is great with cold water gushing through your feet. Go deep into the tunnel to enjoy the awesome experience. The Maggie points add up to the enjoyment

title: Good picnic spot
review: Beautiful place, but now mostly occupied by groups for drinking purpose. Nothing much to do here. One may feel waste of time.

title: Nice Must visit Place
review: Its amazing to be in natural river side playing area which is moreover located at the foot hills of Himalaya.

title: Outdoor activity
review: Very nice place to visit with your family. need to carry extra set of cloth, towels and slipper. you can rent slippers there only for rs 10. There is a change room also.

title: Awesome place to see nature's special
review: Robber's cave is truly a great place to visit for anyone visiting Dehradun. The overall experience is spectacular indeed and walk down the cave is truly memories to cherish forever. Slippers on rent available so that will make life of visitors easy. After a great walk do have hot tea and maggie as an icing on the cake.

title: Robbers cave
review: Lovely place, loved eating Maggie and tea with kids. Kids too enjoyed playing in the water stream...

title: A place to be at
review: Located in the extremities of the city, this place is a cave having chilled water flowing in it. the water wasn't having much of depth but one feels refreshing after whole days tiring schedule after stepping in it.

title: Nice refreshing experience.
review: Been here like two three times still this place gives you all the fun you want. Awesome place for photography because of the ambient lighting due to narrow caves.

title: IIRS visit
review: Nice and quite place to visit. Visit it in evening time before sunset. It is giving nice looks to cave.

title: Awesome view
review: An awesome view and the coolest possible breeze you can feel near Dehradun urban area. A must for aqua lovers

title: Fresh water amidst cave..
review: Must visit in dehradun..winter or summer doest bother about season this place is surely fun for all..couples..friends..family etc..

title: Refreshing, Nice walk in fresh water, Must Visit
review: Robber Cave is just 6-7 KM from centre of the city and well approachable. the route to the location is fascinating. Once you approach this place, you find people renting out sleeper to walk in pebbled water. Those could be useful if you have soft feet. I walked without any sleepers.

title: Amazing & Clean place
review: When I first planned to visit this place I thought it would be in the middle of nowhere but I was surprised to find direction boards towards the place. Not only that but there is also an entry charge of 25 rupees. First things first: It has about more than ankle length money flowing continuously throught the cave through which you have to walk til the end. Wear some 3/4 fourths. Locals also rent slippers at 10 rupees. At the entry and also in the midst there are stalls serving maggi, momos, etc. Coming to the caves it is narrow, dark, adventurous and full of water. When one feels the caves ends, there is actually a way right till the top which leads to hilltop. There are some waterfalls in the cave. The way forward is always around or above those falls. Goin ahead after initial 10 min requires some serious trekking (not possible for aged/pregnant women/with babies). Overall the place is scenic with light piercing throgh the top. Quite clean. One sentence advice: Be prepared to get wet till knees and climb if you want to explore this place in its entire.

title: Very much exciting
review: This place is popularly known as Gucchu Pani and is situated about 1 km from the village of Anarwala.This place is famous for a strange phenomenon,wherein a stream of water suddenly appears and after some meters disappears.

title: very beautiful place
review: ​Some handy tips that might be useful for the travellers

title: Good at natural beauty, could be a better place
review: The natural part of the place is quite beautiful, but the garbage and mis management spoils the beauty. Lovely place to hangout and have fun with friends.

title: Best waterfall I evr visited
review: Indeed it ws the best thng I will remember frm my Dehradun mussorie trip. My 4 yr old daughter also went with me( ofcorse I holded her hand) in ths cave till end. We bth loved it like anythng. Wat lies ahead is somethng which keeps u gng.waterfall at othr end is really the icing on the cake.

title: An experience
review: Quite a unique experience. Loved it! A lot of fun.One can go here with friends and family and create memories.

title: Must visit place
review: This place has its natural beauty which has not been destroyed yet.when you enter the water it gives a very good feel.transparent water .

title: Cave ,River and awesome food
review: Go on a weekday . During daylight hours. Go all the way to the end of cave . Awesome experience.Keep coming back and keep the natural beauty clean for your friends who are yet to see this natural beauty.Enjoy some momo and Maggi at the dhaba nearby ,fun experience to eat yummy stuff while your feet are dipped in the river ,flowing  under your table.The experience is quite safe .

title: A good picnic spot
review: I with my wife visited this place on 23-11-2017 at about 3.00pm.This is a Groups of waterfalls in a natural cave and you have to go in side the cave in water upto your knee. When you are there, its amazing Natural Beauty. You need to wear water proof, which are available on the spot for a payment of Rs. 10/-.As we are senior citizens so it is very risky for us to go in but with care you can go and Enjoy.

title: Cave exploration!!
review: This was the most fun filled cave experience till now. Robber's cave also know as gucchu paani by the locals is a naturally occurred cave in Dehradun which is quiet near to the Tapkeshwar temple. This is a long cave approx 2km (exact can be googled though :P ) with river flowing through it. One can cross the cave which is the most exciting thing to do as there will come many hurdles which when crossed will kind off give a feeling of accomplishment! Walking by the icy cold river is also a fun experience and do eat maggie and tea in the cafeteria just outside the cave. (The tables are placed between the shallow river) and yes can also see variety of birds increasing the beauty of the place. :D

title: Awesome spot
review: Awesome breathtaking open caves with crystal cold clear water. Awesome spot to hang out for a days picnic with family or friends..

title: Amazing Spot! Must Visit place !
review: One of the best places to visit, the place is even better than few of the spots in Mussorie.

title: Must Visit
review: This is the adventurous place.

title: Must go
review: One of the most lovely exotic places of india.give all other place miss but do go here.water was above our knees.avoid in monsoon.slippers are available at 10rs.outside.Dont miss maggie and hot tea sitting with legs in cold  stream.3kms on dehradun mussoorie road.very small signboard so look out for it.

title: It's better than it seems
review: The place seems an usual place with water flowing and people having fun around it.

title: Enthralling caves !!
review: If you go to Dehradun this is the first place you should visit. Tantalizing picnic spot . You have to walk through the water stream flowing in the cave.

title: One of my best cave experince!
review: Robber's Cave is located in the outskirts of the main city of Dehradun and has an amazing green location. The cave is indeed a wonder - worth going there in summer! As the weather is hot outside, the cave is really chill! Initially you have water touching your feet and gradually it reaches your chin! MUST GO!

title: Breathtakingly beautiful
review: I have never been more amazed at the wonderful places that we have in India . Every thing unique and different . The place leading straight to the waterfall is amazing ..walking on water and gives you even more joy . Would love to visit this place again .

title: Best natural beauty of Dehradun
review: A natural spring passing through Mountain and then converts into a river. An outstanding place near Dehradun. It is a wonderful experience to walk through the stream of water between two walls of mountain. Water is cold and have current hence needs to have some safety during the walk. Small children must be accompanied and hold properly during the walk. Lot of photogenic views are available from snaps. Better to carry a shorts so that one can prevent himself or herself from getting wet. A small cafeteria and a few footstalls are available  for snacking. A lovely place to visit.

title: Amazing getaway from city center
review: This place is so peaceful that you won't want to leave once you reach it. The water caves themselves are good but you can also decide to have some maggi noodles and/or mommos in the sun, feet in the water, which makes eating a lot better than you'd expect! We stayed there for 3 hours and it was the best day in Dehradun for us. The water goes up to the knees but it's not cold at all so don't hesitate to go there you won't be disappointed.

title: Nice place
review: Nice walk in water admist caves and a nice view. Good watch but can't compare to mussoorie as totally different things

title: Natural marvel
review: Had heard about this tourist place and was eager to visit. It was really marvelous to see the naturally constructed cave and the cold water running in this caves. Really happy to have visited.

title: Good picnic locale with kids
review: Good location for a family outing. The water is clean, location is still unspoiled.

title: Must visit place
review: The place is one of a kind with Clean water with height upto waist at certain places running in a narrow Valley, the place is beautiful.

title: Excellent spot!
review: A great tourist spot which unfortunately has not been promoted well in the country. We had a great time walking inside the caves with water running beneath and splashing from the caves. Such a beauty. One could imagine the British era when so called robbers would hide here. There is a small fall at the end which if one is able to cross leads to the jungle. Be prepared to get a little wet because of the stream running. Its worth visiting again!

title: Gucci pani
review: It's for couple place specially

title: A place to relax
review: Great place to visit.

title: uniquely  touristy
review: The place is touristy but what m akes it unique is its small eateries stationed in the middle of flowing rivulet. They serve hot and tasty momos and noodles. Better carry your sandals if you plan to get your feet wet. There are slippers for rent, in case you forget. We did not dare to get inside the cave.The water is cool and welcoming.

title: Gucchu pani
review: A must visit place in Doon but avoid during monsoons. carry spare clothes as one always tempted to see what's on the other side

title: Robber's Cave must visit for adventure junkies
review: I really adore this place Robber's Cave, Gucchu Paani in Dehradun Mussoorie Road. As the water, their soo cold with the beauty of this remarkable place. The food eateries outside are also cool as well

title: Surprising place
review: Rober's cave is popularly known as Guchchu Pani locally. A nice picnic place. Water gushes out from top and flows in cave like structure. You have to walk in water (it is upto our knee when we visited in October) and have a glimpse of s tiny but forceful water falls.

title: Gucchu Paani, its really nice place
review: Mostly people come here to enjoy in water and anyone can visit here with family or couple also, here are greenery and beautiful place so must visit once

title: Caverns!!!
review: A visit to Dehradun without being to robbers cave, is not done!!!

title: Wow! Just WOW!
review: Visited here for first time and already fell in love with the place.

title: Dark Cave
review: Youngsters can visit this place easily by walk from the main drop point and have lots of fun (taking bath, having maggi/other snacks or just sitting and enjoying the water flow). There is entry ticket for the place (Nominal charges). One must be careful with the water flow as in monsoon its deep upto the chest inside the cave.

title: Nice picnic place
review: This is a fun place to be at, especially with the kids, since there isn't too much water here. However  would not suggest that you visit this place during the rainy season.

title: enjoyable
review: be sure before you go that you need to be ready to walk through water over stone at least waist deep, meaning need to change clothes and no for old people.

title: A totally different experience
review: This will provide you with a totally different and enjoyable experience. Either get some slippers with good grip or you can take on rent for 10 bucks each since you need to walk in knee level water to reach the falls. The water level varies with the season. In September, it was upto waist level at some points. So, dress up accordingly.

title: Awesome Place to Visit.
review: I have visited this this place in off season inspite of this I have enjoyed very much. One should go in summer peak season.

title: Place to enjoy with friends
review: This is an amazing place in dehradun, as it's not a tourist destination. Gucchu pani was fun with friends, as we had lot of time on hand, so thought of going there. It was fun. It's interesting to walk through stream of water inside the cave.

title: Must visit place when one in Dehradun
review: Yes its must visit place and now a days well maintained clean place. Walking in the water and then a waterfall..

title: Amazing  place
review: Must visit.. Take a short break and enjoy the fall of water in between two mountains... A beautiful natural refreshing fall amidst natural flora.  In summers it's a paradise.  With eating joints outside... A good time pass for locals and especially kids ... A perfect weekend place.  Just Go... I really enjoyed and am a regular visitor now. Pls do carry pair of sleepers or you can borrow @cheap price of Rs 10 from  small shops  outside... Try out Maggi at the outlets ... I swear it's awesome...

title: Dirty, dirtier or dirtiest
review: Why cant Indians promote tourism? If you want to understand this then visit this place. Approach, Maintenance, Crowd Control....name it - everything is bad.

title: Amazing experience
review: Superb place! A nice stream of water welcomes you as you walk in the cave.. The water fall inside is exciting and fun!

title: Amazing Place
review: This was the very first spot we visited when we were in Dehradun. Even though we had some difficulty locating this place. It was worth the visit. Sunlight piercing the crack between the mountains is spectacular. Walking through the knee height water was so enjoying. Something unique. Locals rent chappals for Rs 10 in case if you don't have. They have setup table and chairs in the running water since the flow is not so rapid when we had visited. Sitting and having tea/maggi is fun with water flowing underneath your feet.

title: Good Experience
review: Water water everywhere.. Its a good place for a change with all those caves with water running in it.

title: Good place but very crowded
review: nice place for small visit , plz avoide on weekends best part is water level flutuate as per rain on upper hills .

title: Amazing
review: Great place to visit during Monsoon.. although the way to reach this place is quiet narrow but u will end up having lot of fun..

title: CAVE WITH WATER FLOWING
review: Good picnic spot specially during summer season as one can walk in flowing water and inside a cave but sometimes it can be risky.

title: Robber's Cave.......
review: Nice place to visit  and have some snacks........especially with the stream flowing.....the tickling sensation in the foot....avoid this place during monsoon season.

title: Amazing Places
review: Ooo... this place was really amazing....

title: eacape from summers
review: Robbers cave is usually packed with tourists during summers.

title: Splashing water on a sultry afternoon
review: Robbers Cave is one of the best places to explore in Dehradun. This place was named Robbers Cave by the Britishers as robbers used to take refuge in these caves after robbing. The place is also referred as Gucchu Pani which is located at Anarwala village about 8 kilometers from Dehradun city.Many people come here to explore the unusual cold springs. You can have fun here while splashing cold water on your partner on a sultry afternoon. When you go inside the cave it’s like a quest, people fold their trousers and roll up their sleeves to avoid getting wet, yet nobody escapes from the splash of water. One should avoid visiting this place in monsoon season and it’s better if you carry an extra pair of clothing and some food.

title: Room Is Good Condition
review: Hi, I visited at dehardun in last week.This is very nice place and again i hve to comes to these areas.

title: Gucchu Paani
review: A very nice place for family picnic. Have been there few times and found it a nice, lonely place good for spending leasure time.

title: Excellent Place to Visit
review: Very Good Place to visit.. Water is flowing from cave which is around 300 mtr. long.. Good Experience.. One can float along with flowing water.. Entry fees of Rs. 25 per person.. Take your Shorts & Flooters along with you while visiting Robbers Cave. Local People know this place by the name of Gucchu pani..

title: Dirty and overcrowded
review: After reading many positive reviews, we decided to visit the Robber's Cave. This is a little far from the main city and was difficult to get a cab to take us there.

title: Must visit attraction while in Dehradun
review: Robber's cave was better then our expectations. It was full of tree, water & stones. As one will enter towards cave; it will become more beautiful & adventurous.

title: Robbers Cave - watery place near Dehradun
review: Its a nice place for one time visit if you think Sahastra dhara is not that exciting in Dehradun. Well, you will find water & watery caves here so as a precaution keep you footwear & chapalls on. If visiting this place, dress casually with T-shirt & Shorts combination otherwise your clothes will get wet (if you are wearing jeans/trousers etc). This place is not suggested for solo visit so visit in a group. They start early in the morning around 7am so if you are an early riser and want to avoid the afternoon crowd then plan your visit accordingly.

title: Excellent place to be..
review: In monsoon season with plenty of flowing water this place is must see. Remember to leave your belongings before entering cave if you want to enjoy fully.

title: Be there
review: I have list my trip experience:

title: Experience of life
review: You can walk inside this cave which is a ridge. You will see spring water coming from the stones, touch the water and it is just pure. I had never imagined such a place exist on earth. This nature experience was thrilling for me.

title: A place to be
review: The soothing sound of water and the beautiful caves mesmerizing.

title: Natural Cave with water
review: Never thought such a place in doon...but wow it was so beautiful ...Cave with water ...u can go inside take dip ...swim n enjoy....please don't litter ...its perfect n natural..

title: Great picnic spot but mostly crowded
review: I have visited Guchu Pani several times over a period of past 10 years. Initiailly it was a quiet picnic spot where we could spend time in the heart of nature, soaking our legs in the flowing water, exploring to see the source of the water etc, without bumping into so many people. Over the years, the popularity of the place as a picnic spot has gone up and the increasing crowd makes it not as attractive as before.

title: Magnicifent
review: Awesome adventure, my driver told me that it is not possible to complete during this time of the year, still able to complete the whole 650m stretch. In the midway there is a fall, & you have to take the diversion, keep hope you will find the end. During this time water level is very high, hence it is not recommended for ladies & childrens

title: great place with natural beauty would love to visit gain & again
review: great place with natural beauty would love to visit gain & again. one should must visit this place . like most

title: Fabulous
review: Have never seen any place like this... thrilling..... soothing... relaxing... enjoyable.  Kids love it. Take a ball For kids to play. There is a lawn to play. There is water knee deep which u can wade through.  Wear comfortable clothing to wade through water.  Keep kids close and hold their hand. U can sit in water and have hot maggi with tea... enjoy. It's a long open tunnel like cave with a glimpse of sky above through the mountain cave. For teenagers and trekkers...you can move ahead in cave through a narrow passage which is believed to open on other side but be careful.

title: Breathtaking natural beauty
review: Small stream with knee deep water flowing throw this small gorge, Out of the world experience. water dripping from the trees above & side walls give a feeling of rain.

title: Fun trip from Dehradun
review: On my recent stay to Dehradun, I decided to drive here. Ensure you use Google Maps to be able to figure the driving directions since the boards are few. Once I reached there, it was really worth the drive. There is a nice walk through a stream of water to what they call the caves. Remember to carry your slippers and half pants if you really want to enjoy the walk in the water

title: Birthday celebration
review: Awesome place for hangout with frnds. We enjoyed alot there. We love  the view of cave. Everyone must visit there atleast one tym

title: Water Walk !
review: I have been to Dehradoon many a times but had never visited this place but post visiting this would say the best and must visit in Dehradun. Though the path is little tricky and not suitable for elders & aged people beyond a point but for youngsters the thrill begins from the point of fall.

title: Good place to visit but during monsoons
review: I visited the cave in June. It is exciting more for the kids. It is little off route from rajpur road. We took as cab to reach there. Being hot summer afternoon you need caps to cover yourself else you will burn. It was bustling with visitors. It is advisable to keep your belongings in locker outside as many people got there phones and other stuff wet in water. The water level was low much below the knees. The caves are huge and are made naturally so they look amazing. But it would be better to visit during monsoon or just after that when the water level in high. At  places the caves were dark, so would be tougher for older people to walk. Also the water was dirty so it was not much fun. There are snacks points outside where you can sit and enjoy maggie ,tea etc.

title: Cave to be explored
review: There is a history behind this place its been said that in past the robbers use to hide in this place its an awesome place to get chilled specially in summers though you can always visit this place in winters too, avoid going in monsoon's as I have heard a lot of mishappenings due to the rise in water so guys just take care of little things and you will really enjoy the beauty and attraction of this place. their are locals who serve you yummy Maggie and also their is a huge owl you would certainly like to see. Must go place at least once in lifetime.

title: A good place to go once
review: The caves is pretty good especially everyone will enjoy reaching the far end after climbing that big stone blockade in the middle. The water was clean when we went in summers and the place was less crowded.  Kids will also like the place. However other than the cave and small water stream there is nothing else.

title: Awesome place!
review: It's a very unique place and a must visit if you visit Dehradun. The cave is beautiful with natural water running.

title: Mind refreshing
review: It is a top attraction of Dehradun. This is a cave filled with running water. The climb up is refreshing. Also you get to soak in the water

title: Hidden treasure
review: Robber's Cave is also known as Guchhipani or Guchu Pani. It is a beautiful place for picnic.

title: Very good n refreshing experience
