review: This is the best place to visit in dehradun. The place looks like a cave but its actually a path between two hills n at the end there is a very small waterfall. The water keeps running throughout the path. Entry ticket was around 20-25. You get lockers inside to keep you belongings and one can hire slippers from the locker person so that you can easily walk in water. The continue flow of water give a relax feeling. Over all a good and different place to visit. There are many food n snack corner to fill you stomach.

title: Good fun for kids
review: Best place to visit if you are in this area. Visited dehradun, mussoorie and rishikesh this month but this attraction is the best among all nearby attractions. Kids enjoyed splashing in water and we let them do so because water was clean not like kempty falls which are overcrowded and stinking. If u move inside the water is deeper so not safe for small kids to walk on their own. And at the end there is a small waterfall so its worth going inside waist deep water

title: Good site bad management
review: The site is good with rive flowing and water stagnating to provide swimming options. However, your privacy will be intruded, be prepared for that, I think you understand what I mean. Poor maintenance and littering around will be a disappointment. However, if you choose not to go to the main area but venture towards the lower side of the river, you will like it more.

title: Amazing place to visit
review: Super cold water, high hills, spooky way, a tea shop on the hill,  a fountain inside the cave , greenery all around. Excitement, enthusiasm,  adventure..  And on the top of that someone shouted there's a big snake in the water..  ... Excitement increased manifolds...

title: Beauty is the word
review: Are some people crazy. They call this place overrated  and filthy . But I don't believe in these  nonsense. It is the  most attractive place for  me in the mountainous city of Dehradun . I hope this helps you to do the planning of your vacation.

title: A little dose of adventure!
review: Cold flowing water..through the cave..It's a rainy cave.. It's a 100m cave...But nothing much to do...It's more of a touchdown..If you want to take proper bath in waterfall then better go to bhatta fall(mussoorie).

title: Dirty due to non maintenance, over crowded
review: The place is must visit in Dehradoon, but request management to clean the place, they charge Rs 25 for ticket, atleast 1000 visitors a day, 25000 daily collection and no maintenance, The place can be maintained so beautifully but its worst that these people just don't.

title: Nice little adventurous plc
review: Nice place for a change but one shud carry a fresh lot of clothes and slippers if possible. We sighted a water snake also thr, so b carefull. Not for elderly ppl

title: Must visit....avoid weekends
review: A very good experience .Avoid weekends.September and October are best seasons to visit.Slippers u get on the  spot.Take extra pair of clothes as those u r wearing are bound to get wet.Take a towel too.

title: Bleh !
review: Robbers Cave may have been a better idea had the management made any effort. Just taking an entry fee doesn't make a place tourist friendly.

title: Nice place
review: It is a walk amongst a natural cave with water running at feet level, slippers are a must and can be rented at the place, not much to do except the walk, but it is totally worth it

title: Beautiful..but too crowded
review: It is a beautiful place.. definitely more beautiful if you find less people when you visit!

title: Waterfalls in the caves
review: Thoroughly enjoyed the walk through the caves. Amazing experience. We went without our parents. Good thing is the area is flat. Not much climbing involved

title: Excellent
review: Awesome experience. Must visit place in Dehradun.

title: Small but good fun
review: water is upto knees for 100 -200 mts . looks like cave but without roof .

title: Nice place to visit in Dehradun
review: Robber's cave or locally known as Gucchu Paani is a nice place to visit if you like the idea of trekking in water and enjoy a waterfall. The place is accessed on foot for about 1 km.

title: Over crowded terrible place
review: worst place i visited in Dehradun. Huge crowd. Muddy water. not suitable for children and old age. nothing attractive. and they are charging Rs 25/- PP to see that "kichad".

title: Beautiful place. Enjoyed a lot.
review: its a must see. Go there in evening around 5 pm to enjoy the breeze and eveneing coolness. Water is anyway cool. its a walk for a km to the falls. there small resturents, where u can put chairs in water and enjoy hot cup of tea and maggie. very good place.

title: Good place but over crowded on weekend's.
review: I had visited this place many times when I was in college. At that time it was raw place with very less visitors. Last time when I visited this place found it overcrowded and commercialized. Now one have to take a ticket to visit this place. On the entrance of cave few people have opened  Maggie kiosk which make this place more crowded. This place had lost its charm. Will recommend to visit this place on weekdays , on weekend it is very crowded.

title: Excellent place to visit
review: Beautiful place. Running water coming out of a mountain. You can have snacks, sitting in the water. Could be crowded some time. At the end the water is little deep and you can take bath also.

title: Wonderful experience in robbers cave
review: Very exciting place in dehradun for adventure lovers and couples. Tourist must visit and enjoy cave trekking experience in your life.

title: Short trip to Robbers Cave
review: We went to attend marriage at dun in March 2016. And heard about Robber s  cave  (locally known as Guchhupani ) which is a river cave formation located approximately 8 km from the centre of Dehradun city. It is a natural cave formation.

title: Awesome place. Avoid on a weekend
review: An awesome place to be! Try and avoid it on the weekends though, when it gets very crowded.

title: Weekend party place
review: If you are going to Dehradun, this place is a great visit for weekends. There are some swimming pools apart from the main attraction which serve nice Chinese food.

title: Awesome feeling
review: This is a must visit place of dehradun. You will feel excited while walking in the river and going through the mountains passage. Passage is small and narrow and two huge mountain on both side makes it little scary too ;)  but feeling is awesome.

title: not so impressive place
review: The place has a good natural beauty but not suitable for family outings. Good to go with group of friends to have fun.

title: Evening Stroll
review: For a Doonite this place brings childhood memories back, and thats good for nostalgia but nor so good for reality.

title: Nice place for a one time visit
review: A few suggestions- Wear something loose or short as the water is knee deep, wear comfortable flip flops as they too would get wet and most importantly do try maggi and chai on your way back.

title: Different place
review: Robbers cave is a good and different place to visit for sure. Kids would certainly like it as well as elders. Frequented by couples all over Doon this place takes you to Pirates of Caribbean state of mind the moment u enter.

title: best attraction
review: earlier it was not very popular.. hut now it has become one of the best tourist attraction of dehradun.. this plwce is little adventurous.. u have to walk against the flow of water surrounded  from both sides by the huge moutains.. the scene n feeling are awesome.. at the end u can enjoy the waterfall n get some good clicks.. what i loved the most was that the small shops there had sitting arrangement of tables n chairs well inside the water.. u can dip ur legs in the chilling water n enjoy maggies n other snacks over there... no need to worry about ur belongings as u can get the same deposited in rented lockers.. n there is also fscility of clothes changings.. must visit if u r travelling to dehradun

title: Enjoyed Guys !!
review: Hi Guys !!

title: Cave with water fall
review: The cave is long and slippers are provided on rent. There are natural falls and springs and you'd love to see the beauty of nature closed in the valley like structure

title: Fun place !
review: I visited Guchhupani with my friends. All nice ! Peaceful area with natural delights ! Worth a visit .

title: wow place..
review: didnt expected such a great place where in you walk between huge natural caves in water !! its a good place to relax and walk some distance in running water.. There is a water fall in the end and you reach around knee deep water in the end. You even get sleepers on rent just before you enter the caves in case you are wearing shoes..Best part is that you have food stalls outside and they serve on tables and chairs which are in water ! Yes, you can have hot maggie or omlettes sitting on chairs with your feets in water :-)  A must go place to relax..Heard from the locals that the water level rises very high during/after rains but it was super good to visit in May 2016.

title: Good Experience..
review: This is a very attractive place to visit, as you will find very less places where you can walk into the water between rocks and mountains.

title: Dirty and overcrowded
review: I had visited this 5 years ago and had been left spellbound by its beauty-- a sparkling silver stream gushing out of a cave, just deep enough that you could comfortably wade through it, away from the chaos of the city. Now, the natural beauty of the place has been entirely obliterated, thanks to the invasive commercialisation that place has undergone. The stream has been made filthy by the hoards of dirty bodies that enter it. The once-clean stream, has now turned into an algae-infested mire. The administration cares for nothing except revenues and the vendors too thoughtfully exploit the place for their purposes. The insensitive tourists throw plastic wrappers and bottles into the stream after eating. This sight deeply pained me when I was visited the place last time.

title: visit to Robbers cave
review: wonderful place for adventure.cave,stream and trees..walking through the flowing water is awesome.time flies away

title: A nice place to visit
review: The place is excellent to spare about an hour or 2. The experience is very different than usual waterfall. It has about half a km long way into the gorge, walking into ankle deep water stream before you reach a small waterfall. Ensure that you use slippers or rubber sandals which are even available on rent @10/- outside the cave.

title: Thrilling and Stunning
review: Really Adventures and Activity Oriented area, Cave was so deep and rock climbing was exiting, story behind the name was thrilling, good area to spend a day trip, keep your extra cloth for bath under baby water falls.

title: Awesome place, very cold water
review: Beware of robbers and enjoy the place. Water is very cold and its thrilling . I visited with friends but you can go there with family also

title: Nice place to visit while at Dehradun
review: Though most people visit the Shahasradhara falls, the Robbers cave or Guchhupani as its also known is a much better attraction. Before going there if possible wear knee length pants and rubber sandals or else you can hire sandals before you wade in knee deep water to see the waterfall inside. The entire water walk is safe and since there are evenly laid stones below there is little chance of falling down. The caves are interesting and in some places a lonely boulder stuck between the two sides of the hills makes it very interesting.

title: Nice place to visit , very cold water on summer
review: This place is very good however you will have some problem in narrow road . It will be paissa basul view and feel.

title: Superb Experience
review: A relatively clean place with not too many tourists since we went early in the morning. The concept of walking through water in a cave was super fun. The kids had a blast. It is a must do in Dehradun.

title: Best place in dehradun
review: If you are in dehradun then this place is worth to go. Awesome place to enjoy. Full of cold water. Tricky ways between the caves. Can go with family or friends or with anyone.

title: Great Tourist Attraction
review: Provides a good option to appreciate the wonders of nature. The cave is natural with refreshing water and offers a good photo opportunity to the visitors. Don't be afraid of the approach road. You will surely enjoy the experience and kids are going to love this

title: Robbers cave not to miss
review: Robbers cave is definitely one time watch a site at Dehradun .plz take Rubber sleepers with u to walk in the cave and better to walk with shorts and t shirt

title: Wonders of Nature!!!!
review: Great place for good fun specially for kids. Carry your sleepers as you need to walk inside the cave through water. Water is clean and only up to your knees.   Robber's cave  is famous picnic place in Dehradun. Good photography opportunity at the caves. Don't be scared of approach road. Must visit place atleast once. My family had fun time.

title: Nice place for summer vacation
review: I think best time is summer. From June to August, whole India suffer with temperature but here we felt fabulous and spent 4 hours. We couldn't believe that how much we enjoyed.

title: Unique Place
review: Just enjoy the chilled water coming from cave. Perfect place for summer. enjoy the eateries. need sleeper to enter cave. be cautious on slippery rocks

title: amazing way of water
review: This place is adventure for family ... the definate visit while in dehra dun ... the kids gonna enjoy the ride in the water which leads to water fall... although i was unlucky as after some distance the snake was seen and have to go back to the start line ... overall superb

title: Lifetime experience
review: Amazing place to enjoy with your friends, family and as a couple. Beautiful waterfall at the end of the cave is amazing. Nearby Maggi and momopoints are best. Don't forget to carry along your slippers or you can rent it as well.

title: Awsome place
review: awsome place.go there with frnds in summer U can play with water at there... very enjoyfull place is this!

title: Interesting Outing
review: This attraction is only 3 KM from the Dehradun Mussoorie road and our Taxi Driver did not know about it!  Its worth visiting - interesting caves with ice cold crystal clear water flowing out.  There is a good waterfall inside a cave which our kids could climb up to.  Food at the stalls outside was quite tasty too.  Do not miss if you are students or travelling with kids.

title: It looks haunted, but is great to thrill
review: This place was hardly a KM away from my resort in Dehradoon. Entry for this place is very minimal which everyone can afford. This is just for the maintenance purpose by the authority. This place might look boring from far, but as close you go as crazy you find this.

title: Best place
review: The place is good but the water is dirty. The place is very beautiful. The way is tgrough a mountain which has made way for water by cutting it. Please visit. Words are not enough to express it

title: Cool
review: This place - also known by the name 'Guchchupani' - is to spend some time with amazing works of nature. The trench is about 400 m long and you make your way through the flow of water. Tourism Department charges Rs.25 for entry, though there appears nothing to justify the charges.  At many places, in the stream, one could see the leftovers like empty bottles and packets.

title: Good and enjoyable place to visit
review: This is nice place to cool down in natural environment. Water was clean. Since outside it was very hot, it was good to be inside cave with water flowing under you. Please make sure you wear comfortable clothes and have mobile / cameras covered as water keep falling from the top. They do provide rubber sleepers on rent (10 INR per pair). Kids will really enjoy in water but must be watched as some places, it is deep. Old people will find difficult to go beyond certain points.

title: Exciting experience...
review: This is a wonderful place to have some fun and thrill. It is a deep gorge between two hills in which the stream flows. Since it is shallow, we can walk through the gorge on the stream and reach the water fall. Children will enjoy as its dark and thrilling for them to walk through the water and the gorge. After the rains the flow of water may be rough and it may not be suitable for kids. Its best to visit during summer when the water level is low and calm. Its about 8 kms from the city.

title: Awesome place to Visit
review: A place which beats the heat, Very cool in between the big cave between the mountains.. It gets cooler n cooler as you move in.

title: For good time
review: Less water probably due to summer. Visit was good. Potential to be a good place, spoiled with littering. We spent half an hour that's enough. Probably more interesting during winter.

title: Robbers cave
review: This is a very pleasant visit in this cave. Good to see this cave with floating waters. Must visit in dehradun for this cave

title: Wade through the water in a cave
review: This is a very pleasant place to visit with your family.  Get there early and you can avoid the crowds.  its a unique experience.

title: Nice Happening Place
review: A good one time place to visit. However ironically with more tourist footfall negative impacts are there on natural resources/beauty. The water was now more polluted & usual garbage problem was there due to so many food stalls.

title: Nice experience.......
review: Nice place......... nature lovers will love it............ its better to go there with floaters bt slippers are available on rent

title: Nice place
review: Robers cave is most natural place  place in dehradun ,  its pic nic place for summers , dont forget to take sleepers n short before visiting this place.

title: Cool place don't miss if you are in Dehradun
review: Places is located in cantonment area around 10 km away from main city.

title: Guchchu Pani aka Robber's Cave
review: Beautiful place with clear and cold water in between a cave with lots of stones. The top point of Rovers Cave gives extremely beautiful sceneries.

title: It is an awesone place and you would have only dreamt about visiting q natural place like this
review: The cave is really scenic and you love to walk in the water, mountain free flowing water at your feet. The cave and the path is really gorgeous to see and you should just briskly walk through the same. You will encounter fountains as well and a short waterfall. You can climb up the mountains and sit there as well, these rocks are not very high. There is even a maggi point at a rock situated at a height.

title: Most underrated place
review: If FRI is a must visit place on trip advisor then this place has to be way above it. You have to walk through a slit in a mountain. The water is partly cold, partly warm and extremely clean. Keep walking in and you will find a spot where they will show direction to canteen. You can even climb up all the way.

title: Beauty of Nature
review: This is a place were you can relax and enjoy the waters. Went early in the morning to avoid the crowds and enjoyed the pleasure of fishing along with the local people, Although the only thing to be careful about is some broken bottles and glasses in the water can hurt you.

title: Far from maddening crowd
review: I went till I reached the small fountain. If you like trekking then it is a good idea to go along the cave while you are half submerged in water. Avoid going far if you are over weight.

title: Enjoyed the waterfall
review: Cool place to visit during summer. It is better to visit with friends as you may feel lonely if you go  alone.

title: “Beauty of Nature”
review: This is a place were you can relax and enjoy the waters. Went in the afternoon and enjoy each bit of it water as cold and felt nice when walked through it and also eat your favorite maggi and enjoy the place

title: Awesome Place! Must Visit!
review: It was a wonderful experience walking in between the cliffs, wading through the water! The water is crystal clear...u can see the pebbles beneath. Do not stop till you find the water fall at the end. It is just awesome! Climbing on the rocks it was like we had discovered the waterfall! Ice cold clean pure water! Even on the top of the rocks water flows....must experience! I have been to many waterfalls and caves and I must say this one is one of the best! We enjoyed a lot! Better to wear shorts as you will have knee deep water as you go in.

title: Awesome place to visit.
review: Had an amazing time visiting this place. Sleepers are available for a  minimal cost of Rs.20. Found a small waterfall at the end of this cave. Enjoyed snacks and tea while siting on the chair in between the River stream (River was damn cold). ;)

title: Must visit ..one of the best place..
review: Absolutely one of the amazing place to visit..

title: If you have extra 2-3 hours to kill
review: Went by auto rickshaw. Stroll in between two mountains shallow river stream, walk right to the end there's a waterfall. After walk back out can drink chai and relax on the river.

title: Good a sudden and unplanned visit
review: The cave is more or less opened one with water, which is ankle deep. It is good hangout place for youngsters. If you have some time left in Dehradun after visiting other places, visit this place. The place looks a little commercial type.

title: Natural & serene
review: Clear water running through the rocky crevices and superb water flowing down the falls. Tourists though do not bother to maintain the cleanliness of the place, throwing plastic bottles and other trash on the rocks and with a couple of smokers throwing the cigarette butt almost on our head.

title: Nice place
review: beautiful .. nice place for short visit. good area around, water and food around.. sit and relax. must visit

title: I love it
review: I am from this place I love it please please visit this place u feel very relax in this place come with your friends and family

title: Guchu Pani - Natures Gift
review: The place is really worth to visit. Blessed with nature's gifts. The water flows between 2 rocks like an heaven. You can go through 1 mile long walk with full of water and at some place you'll find showers from the rocks make the atmosphere rainy.

title: awesome place
review: awesome place. during out trip to mussorie we planned to visit robbers cave. had doubt about this place since very few people go there. but feeling was completely opposite when we reached there. it became best spot of out whole trip.it is so natural.nothing man made n very new thing to explore.still couldn't believe we have so amazing place in India.its sort of cave n water flowing swiftly.we have to walk on water to go to d end point of the spot.dont stop when u think this is end coz at d end it hav very beautiful waterfall.last thing about this place I remember is that we had our best maggi together in middle of flowing water.

title: WITH FAMILY IN MODERATE WEATHER
review: Great location with awesome caves.Nice place for picnics.lockers, swimwear available.Avoid going alone and do wear crocs.

title: Must visit
review: Must visit place if you are going to Dehradun,bit adventorous.deep water is flowing through the gap between two huge rocks creating a great ambiance

title: Great fun, must do!
review: Frankly driving off the well paved highway into a narrow broken village road was disappointing for the first 3 kilometres. By the time we reached the entry it seemed like a wasted effort. Once inside you suddenly feel overjoyed, chairs and table laid right on the stream, folks were feasting on Maggi/momo's with their feet in the water, and the sight of a stream emerging from a cave. My son (4 year) was overjoyed with the fact that the water was his knee deep (1/2 ft) and he was wading through it as we approach the cave. The walk to the water fall through the gorge is about 150 Ft, all through you have spots to click pics. Be careful not to carry electronics/car keys as you might wet them as you approach the falls. Overall a great experience for kids and adults.

title: Robbers cave was good, not great
review: it was nice change from Shastradhara in Dehradun. It was nice place. Canteen and shops were well maintained. And we can actually go upto 3 km in water cave. Although, small children and old aged(above 60) need to take care.

title: adventures enjoyment
review: Robbers cave is one of the best place to visit in dehradun, it is a cave have the the flow of natural water from mountains, , really an adventures pkace.

title: Get away from it all.....
review: Nice to get away from the hubbub of Dehradoon, cool water and fantastic gorge to walk down. Rent some flip flops to save your feet from the stones.

title: Wonderful
review: Rober's cave in dehradun is a lovely place to visit. One should go to see its natural beauty and also enjoy the bath of sulphur water.

title: Great place to visit.
review: It was a surprise find by a friend on trip advisor. This is a place worth visiting.

title: Average
review: On my visit in Dehradun, place is bit average, dirty and heaps of alcohol usage in nearby areas. other than that it was just fine!

title: excellent place to visit with youngsters ...very adventurous
review: great spot for a adventure there will be 2 hurdles .. think only youths can cross that .. but local around there spoils the place.. but totally a great spot for picnic..

title: Mesmerising
review: The most amazing and mesmerizing tourist destination of Dehradun. Some people even say that this cave has active walls and can change its position over time

title: Amazing cave
review: It is also known as Guchhupani locally. It’s a long cave covered by high rocks on both of its side with slight open top. At some places the top is also covered by some rocks. And at the end of the cave there’s a waterfall. The whole natural beauty is very attractive.

title: Good place to see caves if you don't mind a bit garbage
review: This place is good if you don't mind garbage floating in water. You may visit it once to see the caves but don't be surprised if you find diapers floating in water. It's a bit overcrowded but if you keep trekking till the end of the caves you can find a less crowded spot. Beware of monkeys and drunk hooligans.

title: Mysterious Caves leading to a small waterfall!!
review: The best place to visit in Dehradun after the Forest Research Institute. One can walk up to the waterfalls at the end wading through the flowing water

title: Nature's delight in the city
review: Visited Robber's Cave locally called as Guccupani in December. There is this massive cave and a cascading waterfall at the end of around 500 meters. There is a canteen inside too.

title: Cool mysterious caves with usual picnic fairground atmosphere just outside!
review: The caves are worth a visit despite the crowded stalls and shops right outside. Go deep in to experience the chilly watery hiding places of robbers from long ago.

title: Beautiful Cave
review: Robber's Cave is an amazing  place where you can spent good time, play in the flowing water and enjoy beautiful surroundings. Some eating joints are there where  you can have momos, maggie and noodles.

title: If in dehradun must visit
review: Muat visit place prior rains. During monsoon rain water level could rise suddenly. Nice cool place to relax.

title: "Ok" place to visit
review: Been to this historical place used by "Robber's" in ancient time and hence the name - "Robber's Cave"...Its calm , Not so quiet but yes pictureous...

title: A must for nature lovers...
review: Also known as Guchu Paani. This place is real fun…you can sit inside the flowing water and if you are brave heart, you must go inside the cave…it is bit scary but fun. I went deep inside, till the end of the tunnel but doubly assured about the water levels & your swimming skills.

title: Visit to Robber's cave
review: It is a Historical place to visit. You will find number of waterfalls there & it is easily reachable. Also it is an adventurous place & the water level will increase as you will move forward.

title: Good
review: It's a good place to spend a few hours with friends and family. Walking through the stream is fun. Need to carry clothes for changing.

title: An awesome place to visit
review: A kind of place i never visited before. Gives a feel like a cave in which we have to cross a little distance by passing through cold water. A little bit terrible task but yet such a nice experience. This place was used by robbers in ancient times to protect themselves. It is more convenient for you to wear a legging or shorts up to your knees so that you can easily walk in water. Also you need not take your own sleepers in water. You can get it on rent there only.

title: Fun !!
review: An awesome place to have fun with family/girlfriend/kids. Its a very unique experience here and feels rejuvenating as well. Having chips and chai sitting on the flowing river is too good.

title: Robbers Cave, Guchhu Paani
review: Robbers cave or Guchhu pani, is very adventurous place, with long tunnel between to strait hills and river between them. This place is too scary in evening or dark time, so dont dare to go there in evening or dark time. This place is simply awesome.

title: Definitely worth a visit. It's not a cave, it's a gorgeous gorge!
review: For years I've avoided this attraction due to someone saying it was a boring cave. It is not. We have just visited in December where the clean (looking) water, never more than knee deep flows through the 400 m long gorge. At times the gorge may be about 30 m deep with light streaming in from above. The entrance fee is just Rs 25 and there is a range of small restaurants now. There is parking for vehicles, at a nominal cost (Rs 10 for my motorbike).

title: Must Visit
review: I visited Dehradun in Dec 14 and I think it was the best time to visit. North on Winter you will just enjoy. Robbers Cave or Guchhu Pani as they say in local had an interesting story.  They say robbers use to move in and out from there.  It's A cave filed with water during rainy season but winners you can see and go deep in the cave.  Please if you are visiting keep extra set of clothes as well as carry slippers with of forget my advise wear 3/4th or burmuda as you have to travel in the cave walking in knee deep or at some spots Waist deep water.  Don't worry is safe but if water level is high advisable not to ask children to go inside with you. Place is very close to the city.  Over driver of can while driving to Robbers Cave also shown us the spot where a scene of Shaharukh's and Karena's from film Ashoka was Filmed. You need to pay entry charges minimal.  If you forgot to carry clothes people there have clothes and slippers on rent.

title: Alright!!
review: Heard quiet a lot about it.. place is good and something unique but pretty unclean.. crowd was not at all decent. Many drunk people were closeby!!

title: Nature's miracle
review: Robbers Cave (Locally called Guchhupani),  which is half Kilometer in length but quite narrow Gorge formed in a Limestone area of Doon Valley. A small river flows through it. If you are visiting here please wear apparels which dry fast. The place is a natural beauty but takes half kilometer trek to reach.

title: Amazing Place
review: Robbers cave as told by taxi driver that 1 robber was there who used to hide in this cave. Place is worth visiting. Beware of pick picketers avoid going in afternoon time. You have to take sleepers 10/ pair for going into water. In fact there is nothing to see inside the cave nor your camera work because it is not much light there. Just stay at entrance of cave and enjoy the running water. Also enjoy fast food in the shallow river water

title: Must visit
review: You will have lot of fun. You will wade through waist deep water in the naturally formed cave-like rock formation. Carry spare clothes and floaters with you while you go there. You will also get rented sandals over there. Must pay a visit if you happen to visit Dehradun!

title: "Guchhupani"
review: It is a natural cave formation where rivers flows inside the cave. The place is a popular tourist spot . Local bus services are available up to Anarwala Village, from where it is a kilometre's trek away.

title: wonderful place
review: If this was in any western country it would have been hyped so much to make money. If you are visiting around Dehradun/Mussoori, please make it a point to visit Robber's Cave (also called Guchchu Pani). You can walk inside the cave for almost 1km in cold water. It is a memorable experience to sit on the chairs with your feet in water and eat hot noodles.

title: good fun
review: a Nice place to hang out with family and friends . kids love this place very much . there is river flowing in between two cliff . you can walk in the water and can take a dip when you reach at the last point . water level is till knee max . but hold hands of kids as sometimes kids slip with water flow . when you finish the water walk you can sit and enjoy maggi noodles . table r placed in the water which is very exciting for kids .

title: Sagar
review: Nice place to hangout you can enjoy with your family and friends very close to Dehradhun city there are hotels in cave area for refreshments

title: Such a Beautiful Natural Treat!
review: Honestly I had never visited a place like this before. I was surprised to see the cave! It looks magical.. Water is so clean and the cave was adventurous! The food corners serve awesome momos and noodles!

title: Natural beauty
review: Poplularly known as guchupani,  the place is a naturally built cave from  where the  clean water flows through the cave which makes it a completely adventurous place. The food corners around serve hot momos and maggi which adds to the charm.

title: Natural beauty
review: Wow...

title: water.. on the rocks..!
review: robbers cave, dunno why its called that, is quite nice to visit actually. But its like a movie with a fantastic trailer - seems real interesting, until you go in, and then it just offers no thrill or variety or plot twists or any drama whatsoever. Its exactly the same from start to end, and ends rather abruptly...

title: What a cave
review: Most beautiful cave i have ever seen , very cinematic , when you will enter you feel like hollywood movie, very clean and pure water very cold water , i just love the cave

title: Love it every time..
review: This is quite famous as Robber's cave, the place is surrounded by nature and you love the way you take to reach this place. Its inside cantonment area and you feel so cold sometimes.

title: A typical natural place in Dehradun
review: Aaah what a place. this is a small place near cantonment area of Dehradun. some 10 Kms from City Center. accessible by private vehicle as City bus drops around 1 kms earlier. there is cave inside which is a small natural water fall at the end point. The water fall point has an opening so dont fear of darkness.

title: Robbers cave
review: I never enjoyed a trip inside a cave like this... That too with family... There are excellent place to romance,  even a nude bath provided u go deep inside the cave.... The extreme end is the water fall... To climb to that fall take adequate dress to get wet... And dont get skidded due to slippery rocks.... The water was cool... But tolerable.... Entry charge of 25 per head and parking charge of 30....All newly wedded couples must go to the spot...

title: Different.
review: Why different because we have not come across such a place maybe other than the small streams which we stop by during road trips.

title: suspense thriller experience
review: looks like a shooting destinations with very cold water and chilly environment. carry own slippers . also available on rent. Excellent spot to visit.

title: Nice place. Great experience.
review: You get this good feeling when cool water touches your feet suddenly. Imagine a lot of it and you are at robber's cave aka Gucchhu Pani. Ankle deep water is flowing through the gap between two huge rocks creating a great ambiance.

title: good for Nature Lovers
review: awesome feeling. eating maggi infront of waterfall, awesome moments. water reaching 3+ feets when going ahead in cave, clicked photos, enjoyed. only minus was its maintenance, few wrapers nd leftover eatables were seen here and there. overall a nice experience.

title: Unique Experience of wlaking in fresh flowing waters
review: Must see place.

title: Adventurous
review: Go through the history of Robbers' cave before visiting it. Cold water flows down through the cave. It is a nice experience walking bare foot through that chilling water. It is better to carry a torch if you are visiting at dusk.

title: "The fresh flowing water"
review: The fresh water flowing from the mountains to here...The fresh water kills gems and suppose us to be healthy...The fresh air coming from the atmospheric conditioner helps throw out carbon di oxide from lungs.thank you

title: Best place to visit in Dehradun
review: This place is amazing. You must visit this place if you are in dehradun. It will be best if you reach early in the morning. We reached at 7:30 in the morning and it was awesome.

title: good picnic place in summer time
review: a good place to see and enjoy u can have a bath in a small fall there the place is very beautiful and a must see for tourist the only restriction is go in day time

title: Must visit
review: This is place is very beautiful. If u are a nature lover, u will definitely love this place. Waterfalls at end of cave.. Rock wall almost touching each other and sunlight piercing in the cave through the little gap makes it very beautiful.

title: One of the best places to visit in Dehradun/mussoorie
review: Serene place located between Dehradun and Mussoorie. There is a small waterfall-like at the end of this cave. You should either rent a pair of slippers or carry along with you the same, as there are sharp-ended stones on the way inside the cave. If you can spare 2-3 hours in your trip schedule to Dehradun or Mussoorie, this place could be covered easily.

title: Must visited place in dehradun
review: Awesome place to visit dont go in pants and shoes go in shorts....full of adveture....at some points u will feel like bear grills...lol...don't forgot go in swimming pool just before the robbers cave..

title: Mind blowing experience
review: The most Awesome place to visit if you plan to go to Dehradun or Mussoorrie. You will the peace of mind. Quite adventurous, wonderful natural beauty to see and enjoy.  Walking into the cave which is open from the top and water is running at the bottom! And the best part is you can have snacks and lunch sitting on the tables which are placed on the river stream( don't worry, the water level is not high).

title: feet in the water
review: this place has a lot of potential in it as a tourist spot.

title: Remember to keep spare clothes
review: Go in shorts . keep going in till the end. Beware of the slippery surface and the rocks inside the water.  Be safe And yes,enjoy.

title: GuchhuPani a.k.a Robber's Cave
review: It is a natural cave with the river flowing ,it is one of the popular tourist destinations in Dehradun.

title: Nice outing
review: Nice 2 to 3 hour outing near ddoon gets a little congested during long weekends . There is a water fall after walking some 100 meters the walk inside waters is nice . There are some snacks tea noodles shop there for some refreshments

title: "SUPER HIT PALACE TO VISIT HERE"
review: really super hit palace to visit with family or couple......

title: Nice little place but need to be maintained
review: Visited the place around monsoon. Needs to be maintained well especially when an entry charge is being collected from the visitor. Currently a bit dirty due to both authorities & tourists apathy.

title: A  wonder full place
review: A very natural place. Beautiful but unfortunately getting spoil by locals, converting it to concrete jungle unfortunately .

title: Adventurous Place to visit
review: Its an osm place to visit, adventures, romantic and full of fun place to visit... although bad climate we were unable to enter the inside of the cave, as the water flow was at it peek that time. its like water flowing below, mountains on the sides and sky above your head....

title: Don't miss in dehradun
review: This is an excellent site for a family get together. I have been to many places but this is superb and different. The experience of walking in the cave with water gushing is awesome. I visited it in the monsoon and it was a very nice experience. Don't take your elder family members into the water as the bed of the cave is formed of rock and as expected is not an even surface.

title: Fun time
review: Although it has been commercialized, it still is a fun place to visit. The cave is not that clean as it used to be. Make sure your wear something comfortable and carry extra pair of sleepers.

title: Nice place to hangout for time pass
review: If you are thinking to travel this place in rainy days or in rain this place is useless or waste of time & money. Bcoz due to rain the flow of water & the water in the cave increases so you will not be able to enjoy this place with heavy n with hard flow of water. If you love to swim you can go for it.:)

title: Good place go only when there is no rain
review: Good place to explore water caves not much deep but some out of box experience . Don't go during rainy season because there are chances you will get leech . Have fun guys. This place is not much crowdy so you can really enjoy alot

title: An ill- managed tourist spot
review: We were on a 3 day trip to Mussourie when our friend suggested that we take a detour and visit this Robbers Cave and trust me we were not disappointed. It was an amazing experience. The experience of walking in the cave with water gushing is awesome.

title: Amaing Cave tucked in the corner!
review: Went to Robbers cave as a friend suggested. We were surprised to find such a place in Dehradun! Have been in this city quite a number of times but had never heard of it.

title: A wonderful place
review: After visiting most of the sites in mussorrie which was disappointing, this one located in dehradun was just amazing. A perfect place for a photoshoot with water flowing out from a cave. You may walk a bit into the cave if you are adventurous. Make sure you do not walk barefoot as the stone may hurt your feet. Rubber slippers should be worn. From our trip of the whole mussorrie and dehradun, this one place stands out as a perfect natural beauty. A must visit.

title: Superb Place
review: Ohhhhh...Superb place for adventure lovers. Walking in a narrow cave, along the river against the flow over the stones and pebbles was really thrilling.

title: One of the best place in dehradoon
review: this is locally known Guchchu Pani , a stream of water ;in between two very close mountains gives you a feel of a cave ; at the end of this cave there is a water fall where you can take a bath , at the exit of  there is a small restorent and tables and chairs of that are on  1 feet deep  the water ; so you can have tea while you legs are in the water  .

title: Thrilling to see Geology at work
review: The place would always be filled up with youngsters.

title: Good but avoid in  season peak season
review: Well all i can about this cave , its a nice experience to visit this tourist attraction,entry fee is 30 rs per person, but avoid this in  peek season if u r going with ur partner or family bcoz local crowd ( specialy young boys) are vry cheap and there activities are not neglectable.

title: Amazing but ill-managed
review: This is an amazing place. There is a waterfall that falls into a cave sort of area and then flows out slowly. The possibilities of using this as a well managed tourist attraction is immense but like all our other tourist spots, there are a couple of people sitting outside selling tickets and thats about it. If you go on a day when there not many people around, you will thoroughly enjoy it. I will not recommend this on a weekend or holiday though. Locals will almost trample you.

title: Nice
review: Its a nice place to visit with friends or family or both...i recommend everyone to visit this place only in a pleasant weather.

title: Mixing work with leaisure
review: I had gone on an official trip to Dehradun last week where one evening I was told that I could have my evening tea dipping my feet in water.. It definitely sounded a must do things considering I had time in evening.

title: Must go
review: One of the most awesome places to go. A great beauty of the nature...

title: Good fun
review: This place is really good awesome fun. I would say a quick must visit for all. It gives u good scenic views of the cave and river. Since the river is shallow you can walk and enter the cave. Good fun.

title: Visit full of disappointment :-(
review: We visited Robber's Cave (Gucchupani) recently. I visited it on a friend's suggestion. However, I didn't find it interesting. The place is badly maintained. During rains, it gets difficult to actually go inside the cave.

title: "Nice Place"
review: Feeling Superbbbb!!!!!................Guys

title: Underground waterfall
review: The cave is a very good picnic spot, with underground water fall. There is also food joints. Be prepare for the water fall with bermuda, tshirt and slippers.

title: Good Place
review: Good place to visit in summers... can go with family and friends... Awesome place to plan a day out... :)

title: Overhyped Place
review: This is a Overhyped Place . There is nothing except a River and Cave ( Where you cant go beyond 50 Meters ) . Road leading to this place is in Dismal condition. Traffic Jams are common nearby this location . Can be avoided

title: Walking in chilled water
review: The robber’s cave or  Guchhu Pani is a small but beautiful place in Dehradun.All day open,closing time 6 pm in winter and 7 pm in summer.Entry fee is there@25 Rs.After walking around 50 mtrs. On concrete road besides the flowing water you came across small polythene rapped huts selling chappals @10 Rs. Per pair, clothes and some selling fast foods/tea etc with seating arrangement in the flowing water.These huts charges you Rs100/- if you are not ordering anything from them,and believe me, these huts are most unhygienic.Choice is yours.

title: Simply great
review: Great place to visit. Avoid visiting during July-Sep because it is rainy season here. I am a local, hence I would advise you to visit during Oct-May. Come to have noodles/coffee with family. Your feet shall be underwater,rejoicing you. There is a little spring in the end of cave, you can bring bath suit if you wish.

title: Either Robber's or Sahastradhara???
review: HIGHS:

title: Picnic by the gurgling stream
review: A small but popular picnic spot with a gurgling stream, waterfall and  rocks...I was told the place got its name from the fact that it used to be a popular hideout for robbers!

title: Place to chill
review: locally known as Guchhupani. Nice place to visit. It is a natural cave formation where rivers flows inside the cave. Water levels are quite low so can enjoy the fullest. Nearby restaurant is available with decent snacks also.

title: soak ur feet in water and enjoy yummy food
review: It is a nice place to be. There r rides for children and lot of food options. The best thing is tht you can soak your feet in flowing river stream and have a cup of coffee/tea . You get some nice food here.

title: Unique Cave waterfall
review: The stream flowing through the eerie cave culminates in multiple cascades. It's a unique experience of wading knee deep through the icy water flowing through the cave. At the end you are rewarded with the beautiful sight of waterfalls

title: Just Awesome
review: This is place easy to reach. By bus you'll need to walk some distance, better to go by personal vehicle.

title: Nice experience
review: It is a natural cave formation where rivers flows inside the cave. The place is a popular tourist spot.

title: Pledge to save this wonderful archaeological wonder!!!
review: We have been taking college students from different places of Rajasthan and other states to clean up this wonderful place which has been littered and spoiled by unruly and senseless locals and visitors.

title: very nice
review: nice place ..have to walk through water for some distance to get to the other side, so if in winter it will be really cold

title: Ultimate Fun!!
review: Woohhh. Forget the tensions of life. Grab your vehicles(preferably two wheelers) and head towards this crazy place with a large group. The water level is just perfect, dont worry if you are hydro phobic, the stream is strong but you wont drown. Best place for those who dont know swimmimg and still enjoy water bodies. The only thing you will miss is hot maggi, nevermind, chai ki pyali is an all time favourite.

title: very adventurous but spoilt by unruly people, women be careful
review: i visited the place and was very impressed by the water flowing inside the cave giving it a very adventurous feel but unfortunately as we closed in into the middle of the cave that has a small opening with a water falls we noticed a bunch of drunk guys sitting around the waterfalls letching and eve teasing who ever was passing by especially young girls.

title: One of the most mysterious & beautiful natural caves with river inside it
review: Must visit site for family & friends or couples. Do carry a pair of comfortable rubber shoes or slippers as you will have to walk on rocks & in water. Parking is paid these days (was free earlier). No decent eateries around but that keeps the place comparatively cleaner. Breathtaking to walk in this stream-bed inside the caves which are reasonably long.

title: Beautiful caves with water falls
review: One of the best and must visit places in dehradun, a km walk leading upto the falls through water upto lower 1/3 rd of ur leg . slippers are available on rent at the entry pont for 10 rs . Beware of water snakes !!!

title: The best place in Dehradun
review: This was the best location of whole site seeing. Water flowing down the cave and you are going in the cave where its dark and suddenly there is sun light that is piercing through gap between stones above. You can have snacks also while dipping your legs in flowing water. A cup of hot tea, momos and hot nuddles is a wonderful combination after visiting such a beautiful place.

title: Mind Blowing Experience. Make it a Point if you are heading to Mussorie
review: Try to reach there as early as 6 AM. No crowd at that time It is just 8-10 KM  from Dehradun Railway Station. All kind of publice transports have service to this place. The local name of Robbers Cave is "GUCHHU PANI".

title: Beautiful Place
review: A wonderful place not to miss. Beautiful cave with a falls flowing out. Need to walk in the water inside which was quite interesting. The cave was fantastic.Not advised to go in the evening hours.

title: Time wasting
review: This is a place for the tourists to have fun in the water , locally known as Gucchupani. Going to the attraction is a job through the narrow , winding alleys. Your car has to wait and let other cars coming from the opposite direction to pass.

title: great experience
review: must go..trip is incomplete if u dun visit this place..must gooooooo..awesome place...bit risky but adventurous

title: Robber's Cave(Guchhupani)... a must visit sites of Dehradun...
review: Robber's Cave locally known as Guchhupani is a river cave formation located approximately 8 km from the centre of Dehradun City. The cave is about 600 metres long, divided into two main parts. The cave has a highest fall of about 10 metres. It's basically a set of caves that has enough space for people to walk through it, and it has a waterfall at one end. That, coupled with a gentle incline from the entrance forms a lovely stream of clear, clean water which you have to traverse. The stream will vary in height depending on the season, but expect to be knee-height in water. So you need to carry spare lower wear and water-friendly footwear. If you don't have any, don't worry - they rent them at the entrance.  Outside, there are stalls where the tables and chairs are placed in the water. There are also lockers facility to keep your electronics, bags etc before you get into the water. Its a must visit sites at Dehradun.

title: Must see "Gucchupani"
review: This place is awesome. It has small waterfall and need to walk down in thigh high water through cave to see that. this place also has few restaurant that offer you food and can dine sitting on flowing water. Remember to carry your shorts and flat slipper.

title: Eateries have created mess out there
review: Eateries have created mess out there. It was smelling like nothing over there and place seems to be very unhygienic.

title: too crowded
review: Its a nice place but badly maintained...to crowded...people we littering all over? Shops/shack have been built right next to the river bed, stealing away all its natural beauty.

title: a fantastic experience
review: the walk through the small canyon is an experience to see how nature carves through the mountains. Do rent a slipper at Rs 10 before you go just near the walk

title: Alibaba Caves
review: Our driver while taking us to the place said, that these are the Alibaba "khul ja Sim Sim" caves; Nah!! not true...but this place brings you the calmness to senses which you are looking for in the hills. Water flowing through the narrow gorges of the cave and people walking through one by one  because it's too narrow and u end up walking to a water-fall and u go waao....Air is fresh, water is cold and feeling amazing on the skin.

title: Nice thrilling experience
review: It was a thrilling experience in the walking lane of the cave. First of its kind. You have to go deep into the cave to see the waterfall but it is a small waterfall where only 5-10 people can come under the waterfall at the same time. But the passage into the cave was more thrilling. You can have fun in the nearby swimming pools - there are seperate swimming pools for family and boys - which is a good thing. There are small food joints where you can eat. A good picnic spot for 2-3 hours picnic

title: Crowded yet worth it.
review: Tiny pathway(probably created by the constant water flow) between two Rocky Hills. Loved walking all the way up the path. It was hot outside but quite cool when in there and the pleasant feel of the cold water on the feet(do bring slipper, because it would hurt to walk without them on the pebbles).

title: Gucchu Pani / Robber's cave
review: Beautiful natural water flowing from mountain hill, cold and clean. water is never more than above the knee height. it is a thrilling experience passing the hill cliff which is sometimes allowing only one people walking and ultimately reaching the small spring. Best place to visit. nice tea stall on the water.

title: Can be well maintained!
review: This place can be well maintained by keeping the area clean. The travellers take bath in the cave and dirty the place by throwing eatables. The local administration need to be little tight with implementing the rules and regulations.

title: Save the natural Reserve
review: Its a beautiful nature reserve ...walking in water throughout the caves...but very disappointed to see the attitude of people there...its very dirty..everywhere u will find wrappers, banana peel off, used bottles, used diapers...I mean how can u do all this to such natural beauty...sad...people have forgot to use dustbins..plz plz...don't spoil these places...use dustbins

title: "A different experience"
review: This is one of it's kind place exists in India. This is like walking through canyons.The place is locally known as Guchhupani. Normally it is not included in sight-seeing package, so you have to go there separately by a cab. Walking through water inside the caves is really amazing, but try to go there in the morning, when not much crowd is there. The water at some place upto knee level and more. Dresses and shoes are available there for rent if you want to take a bath there.Overall it's a must visit place , but please don't make this place dirty by throwing garbage and polythene.

title: AMAZING PLACE
review: if you are planning a trip to dehradun, its a must place to visit, specially for couples. Best time to visit is during monsoon season. It is popularly known as "gucchu paani" by the locals. The beauty is mesmerizing as you have to walk between the caves.

title: Beautiful location
review: Beautiful location, still natural feels good  only request local administration not to allow further construction n keep clean

title: Awesome place
review: Nice picnic spot. waterfall, caves and water flowing around your feet. Small restaurants are located inside. Carry a pair of slippers or rent it their. Lockers are available for valuables.

title: Cool splash in summers
review: A famous landmark,this spot will refresh you in harsh summers.Be prepared to walk with rubber slippers available on hire at the spot or better carry your own.Be dressed in short leg-wear,to enjoy the knee high ice-cold water streaming in the cave.We enjoyed the hot masala chai with snacks,served by the local shacks at the spot.

title: Tourist place in Dehradun
review: We were staying at Lemon Tree for a night before proceeding to Mussoorie next day. During morning walk, thought of exploring this and took a Rixa. It was a short drive on winding roads going down. Came back in about an hour. It was good outing in a short time. The caves have continuous flow of water which is knee deep at some places  and hence you need appropriate footwear and preferably shorts.

title: Interesting !!
review: My advice: Must take a slipper, stones are sharp. I tried to become smart and suffered. But yup i enjoyed. Best part it is close to FRI, so it becomes a combo

title: awesome place
review: the place is wonderful. its a place where one cant ignore to visit atleast once. its a great place for picnic and outings for some relaxation with natural beauty..

title: Walk in the Water
review: Robber's Cave, also known as 'Gucchu Paani'.

title: good place
review: this place is too good to visit during summer. clean and chilling water. the caves are too good to visit.

title: could have been kept in much better condition
review: Good place to visit in summers.Caves with water coming from it gives really good experience but could've been much better place if the cleanliness of the place be insured as we saw some polythenes and trash in corners and even in water which made this place less attractive.

title: Hello everyone! NEED ADVICE
review: Looking forward to visit this place by mid june just one thing do they have lockers for luggage or may be any other system for keeping luggage ?? We would hire a taxi and we cnt leave our stuff like that any suggestions please!!

title: Also known as Gucchi pani
review: Nice place for all age groups,

title: mesmerising
review: It is a wonderful place to visit especially at the time of dawn or sunrise. Surrounded by mountains and forests. At the end there is a maggi centre whose maggi taste is just awesome. Must try, entry fees is rs 25. It is around 350 meter long. It has water level upto your knees, there is also a waterfall in there. It is is stood place to visit

title: Fantastic
review: The best place to enjoy .

title: natural cave
review: it was a natural cave with waterfall. a long cave with 1 feet water. it was good experience.  a small water fall just end of the cave. no crowd in april, may be in may and june you will get it crowded. dont forget to enjoy with maggi.  you have to pay 25/- as entry fee. also dont forget to bring your sleepers otherwise also you have to pay for this.

title: Must Visit
review: Enjoy walking in the knee deep water upto the waterfall. Adventurous people can further take a hike up to the main waterfall. Make sure you have good footwear for this trek.

title: Fun
review: very interesting place with knee high water that soothes your body and mind. Place is one to remember and is fun to visit with anyone

title: great feeling
review: This is a place where every person visiting Dehradun must go.If you were in Europe they could have charged you in dollars. Try to go in off season as during peak season it becomes very crowdy and dirty. Also do take a dip in the pool located at the end.

title: Good to visit once
review: We visited this place during our recent trip to Dehradun after reading reviews here on Tripadvisor.

title: Walking in the water
review: Hello, this cave is amazing, don't go by the name, it has something else to provide. It shows a different world all-together by closely rocks, trees around everywhere and mainly the water that flows in-between where v need to walk to reach the dead end where a small falls will be falling. Never miss when you visit Dehradun.

title: amazing
review: liked the place, the eating while sitting with ones feet in cold water is a v nice feeling. the time spent there is worth spending, really enjoyed.

title: "WHAT A PLACE"
review: This place looks scary specially when the sun is setting down but that itself is an experience as the cave never ends, forget about returning back again... Must see and try to reach till the end...

title: Adventure spot
review: River flowing between the rocks. Climbing the rocks is adventurous and fun.

title: a cool walk
review: a very nice natural passage through stone and a walk in a cooling water stream in the hot summer. if you don't get bothered with what the fellow men do in terms of jumping and screaming in the walk through the water then a must do. wear shorts and water resistant footwear if you don't want to spend time changing at the site.

title: family#friends#water#maggi#fun
review: Place is fun when water is on (in rainy season,,,,June & July). close to the main city.

title: Robbers Cave
review: This is amazing place and should be in MUST VISIT list while visiting Dehradun. A truly nature's wonder, Robber's cave provide nice cool experience while walking below naturally carved stones with naturally cool sweet water falling from top. You wonder and get mesmerised by seeing this wonderful creation of god. An excellent place to visit with friends and family. Not to miss steamingly hot tea and delicious bhajiya at entrance while returning back. I strongly advise not to come back from cave without getting slightly wet.

title: Fun but crowded
review: The place is fun, with cold water in your feet and a waterfall. The kids have a good time but the place is crowded and hence I was a bit sceptical about the hygiene. But yeah, great for a one time visit and maybe another one when it is not so full of college goers and touristy crowd.

title: Crowded but very  interesting
review: This is a natural formation where water runs between two rock structures . Though at any time you may find the place crowded but it is afun walking in knee deep water to ankle dip water to reach and see water running down from rocks.Unique restaurants that cater to you while you sit in water are also there but rates may be high . Unfortunately these also cause water pollution. Avoid during rains as flash floods are a problem here.Overall an interesting place.

title: Average!
review: I really think the place is over hyped...there isn't anything fascinating about the place..its just a small water fall ( am not even sure if water fall is the appropriate word to describe it)..if u haven't taken your own vehicle it gets difficult to find a rickshaw to get back to the city..the best part of robbers cave is that they have put tables and chairs in the stream and ur served maggi and tea..wat we enjoyed the most was hot maggi while our legs were soaking in chilled stream water..

title: this is amazing place
review: there is nothing to ignore or dislike.keep calm and enjoy the water and scene with maggie and tea :D

title: Fun Fun Fun
review: It's a natural looking artificial cave in between two mountains

title: great place
review: we we were astonished & happy to visit this beautiful place a mist the beautiful surroundings with the water gushing out of the cave & it is a wonderful experience to go inside the cave with water gushing out up to knee & pebbles can be seen on the floor

title: Please not spoil the beauty
review: Visit after 10 years shocked to see nature been spoiled by making shops around n its too dirty, it used to best place in town but authorities spoiled the beauty of this place.

title: NIce place to chill out in Dehradun
review: Robber's cave -> Local name - Guchhupani.

title: just average
review: Keep in mind to wear shorts or at least carry a spare one else you will wet your trousers completely. Nothing very fascinating , its just another tourist spots with people clicking too many selfies & pic than appreciating the water fall at the end of the cave.

title: Review of Robber's Cave dehradun
review: Very Quiet place, very beautiful, slightly far from the city.It has got a story behind the name of this place.Can be visited as a picnic spot.

title: Not safe for single (female) travellers ...
review: Although its one of the best natural/scenic places you would experience ..the locals are a bit notorious lot...its best to travell as freinds group of in min. 3-4 numbers...!! the best experience is to trek over the water fall into the untouched gorge...thats the real beauty of this place.....best time to visit is early morning when there are less people...

title: also known as Ghucchu pani
review: this is a very good place worth at least one visit, near sahastra dhara. the best time to visit this place is in summers, in monsoon the place is usually not advisable to visit.

title: Worth a visit
review: Treat for nature lovers. It is a cave and one can step into the mouth of the cave with ankle deep waters. Traveled in the month of December. The more adventurous part is, one can walk inside from the cave into the deep gorge that has been formed. The water levels rise up to abdomen as you proceed further inside the gorge.It is a long gorge and one cannot locate it's end from the mouth of the cave. Birdwatching is great here as there is forest all around. Don't forget to carry a set of binoculars if you have.

title: its a small picnic spot with too much publicity
review: average place. but if you like to have coffee with bare foot in water then this is a good one. too much commercialization. take shorts if you don't want to spoil your clothes

title: Gucchu Paani
review: Nice place to visit to see magics of nature where hot and cold water are flowing in parallel and doesn't mix of course..

title: Average but worth a quick visit
review: I wouldn't go out of my way for this but it is a nice cute cave to visit with a small waterfall. You should wear loose pants that you can fold up because you will have to walk in water that is above knee height. It is a quick visit and quite cheap.

title: Robber's Cave
review: A Nice place-A small river running thro' a cave.The water is so warm- A thrilling and enjoyable adventure.

title: Natural place
review: Beautiful natural place' a destination not v far from city,but getting un natural due to uncontrolled commercial  set up.

title: robers cave
review: Brilliant.It has water to your knee level.It is the place for adventure.

title: Great Place to eat maggi noodles
review: Just sit in the water's and enjoy a hot bowl of soupy noodles. Legend has it that once it use to be a hiding place of some horse riding robbers, so is the name and indeed you will feel it.

title: Cave
review: drive to the cave is very good. avoid travelling during the weekend due too traffic. you get stuck and no way to turn back. Narrow roads. travelling in winter makes more fun. Fantastic walk in the cave half filled with water

title: Nice Place to have fun with friends
review: its a nice place to visit wid frnds..

title: Amazing fun
review: A unique place, I haven't visited any other place like this. Truly fun place to be. A stream flowing through the river, awesome fun place to go during the summers.

title: Nothing extra ordinary
review: This is a picnic spot for people of Dehradun. Locally it is also known as Guchu Paani.

title: Beautiful....,
review: Robbers cave is a must go place, something different, i mean u don't find a cave with flowing water stream, normally anywhere in North India, u will definitely enjy thr, only thing to be taken care of is the timing of the visit, avoid weekends, visit in weekdays, a lot of couples could be seen passing their time ovr thr, njying maggie....u could even carry ur swimming costume, if u want to take a dip(only for males), only drawback, is the cleanliness, which we Indian are very fond of, throwing our garbage here and there....but u should definitely go... If u r in dun.....

title: Must Visit
review: The Robber's cave is probably less known but one of the must visit places near Dehradun. It is great fun to walk in knee deep water on pebble stones and climb to the narrow opening.

title: Nice place to chill out
review: Its a good place to chill out with friends. I have been here many time. This place is just awesome. Whenever we have some time and we need to chill out we come here. Great thing about this place is that its quite and has water. The shops there has placed tables in water so you can enjoy your snacks while soaking your feets in water.

title: Its Adventures
review: Its one of the best picnic spot those who likes adventures. If people are going Dehradun they must go and see it

title: Robber's Cave
review: Too good.  The flow of water is good.  Remove your footwear and go as far as you can to have an experience of life time. Highly recommended.

title: Robbers Cave
review: This place is located approx 10 kms from Dehradun towards the North direction on Rajpur Road.  Condition of this place has deteriorated a little from the of this picnic spot.

title: Natural place
review: beautiful place to visit, used to be more natural but local restaurants & concrete wall made is unnatural, quite place, need to be clean , specially wafers polythene need to be ban, overall good place to visit.

title: Robber's Cave
review: A must visit, nice experience... Summers is a better time to be there to enjoy the place.... Carry shorts so that you can have loads of fun

title: ROBBERS CAVE - EXCELLENT TREK BETWEEN THE CAVES
review: this i. s a wonderful place the rocks are grey in colour & are made of Limestone  Deposits There is a narrow creek and the river passes in between the mighty rocks . Walking up the river stream  between the narrow creek is really exciting  .

title: Dirty place with no security
review: We went to the Robber s Cave. only on the insistence of our taxi driver. It was nothing impressive. Meandering over rocks and a stumbling path that will probably appeal to college bunking youth. Avoid.

title: Excellent place to hangout for fun
review: Walking between the narrow passage like Cave along with a water stream is really exciting. One should not miss this opportunity to experience.

title: Hang Out Place
review: Nice place to chill out with friends. Water flow is good and now there are shops which serves maggie and tea. Maggie served there is different and with water flowing the taste of maggie and hot tea gets double.

title: Good place
review: It's a refreshing place to visit with kids.

title: The best attraction in Dehradun!
review: Never mind that it's a little out of the way. Gucchu Paani should definitely be on your list in Dehradun. For it's not just something that's easily replicable by brick and mortar :D

title: adventure in cave with water
review: It was an adventures experience we are enjoying water in the cave which thrill us we love this natural process of  water in the cave wr enjoyed butter maggie just outside of the cave which was really very tasty

title: Nostalgia!!
review: As a child in school,just the name "Robbers cave" would send shivers down one's spine. Amongst the most exciting places in Dehradun as a first time visit. Can get really spooky as well but is real fun. I of course have memories attached to this & will be a little biased!!

title: Water running through the cave
review: Water flow through the cave feels great and we have to walk through the water to reach some distant rock obstacle....people have crossed this rock and also have found that water speed will be more after that. Overall it would be great for some slight adventure. Be careful with children

title: A day in a cave
review: if u like doing some adventurous things, u must find some time for this day out. The water flowing in the cave makes it a wonderful experience. There is a kind of pool with water falling continuously in it. recommended to take spare clothes as u can enjoy the shower in the pool.

title: Fascinating
review: If you are in touch with your inner child, then this is a must see. Its a small waterfall and a stream within a gorge/canyon like cave. The fun is in wading through the stream to go to the fall site.

title: Nice place to have fun
review: Its a picnic spot away from the chaos of the town. Going there in a group is real fun. Authorities should however improve the water quality and must ensure for safe environment...

title: Awesome- But over crowded
review: It is totally out of the world experience, its fun when its not crowded. Then you can enjoy to the utmost level. Beautiful fissure between the mountains that has developed into a narrow gorge through the cutting action of water flow. The sun rays coming from the Top look like prehistoric. The best time of visit is around March-April. In summers its good but then crowd and pollution increases.

title: fantastic
review: Its a nice place to visit...we have to carry a chappel or we can rent one (Rs 10/- only) from the area.entry fees will be 25 rupees.water is too cold than the atmosphere. Can have some food from the permissible. No need to carry water or snakes from the top.i enjoyed the vegitablem momoes .....it was really tasty...I would like to share one more thing is that ...the time of visit I have seen a youn hearted couple who were mr.sham (71 yrs) and supriya (72 yrs)  from mumbai ,were enjoing the palce even in their old age and I really got jealous of their partner ship and entertaining mentalitty even their old age....I spend a few minutes with them and I got really a good inspiration in ma life about how to spend time in our life even if we get old....

title: Thrilling experience!!
review: Very different place... The water of the cave touches the knee height in the beginning and goes up to the waist height in the mid. It's adventurous, its romantic, its cool!

title: Forget Kempty Fall.
review: Nice place to have fun with friends and family.

title: Make sure you visit this place
review: Robbers cave is something that should not be missed in Dehradun. The cave starts with knee deep water that gradually rises to chest length. There is a small waterfall at the end of the cave which is a must see. Some Rock climbing and you would also see a bigger waterfall. Slippers are available for rent (20 Rs per pair). Once you return from the cave, the nearby eateries offer hot Maggi which should not be missed. Amazing place to have fun for all ages.

title: be prepared to get all drenched till chest
review: Brilliant!! But dint knew water level is going to be that high. So dint carry spare clothes. Planning a trip again especially for Robers cave.

title: A must visit place
review: Visited with friends. A must visit place. The entire experience of walking on stones bare foot is amazing. Reaching at the end of cave with waterfall is so great and fun.

title: Explorable caves with water trail.
review: Robber's cave, also known as Guchhu Pani is one great explorable cave in Dehradun. Just a stone's throw from the city centre, this place is a good spot for a picnic with friends or family, specially during summers.

title: Simply Brilliant Water Cave
review: I visited this natural attraction twice, first in Nov13 and second recently in Oct14. This is one of the best family as well as honeymoon enjoyment spot in Dehradun. Since it was rainy season, the water soared to waist height, whereas during my previous visit it was till my knees only.

title: Excellent.Sure place to visit
review: Robber's cave is a place you must watch if you stay in dehradun more than a month. situated in  remote place outside the city, the place has a treasure of natural waterfal which comes outside through a acve like path which is a worth adventorous.You can feel the chill of water n the challenging adventure

title: RIDE it !!!
review: ITs the best time to visit RoBBers CAve ,,,, to have some adventure ...as there will water caves, and exporation part to add your fun .....

title: amazing cave
review: bring clothes n sleepers if u wish to stroll in robbers cave..have tea n maggi noodles omlet while sitting on the chair in the water with ur feet relaxing in cool water

title: "Awesome"
review: It's an awesome place ...A must visit for people visiting dehradun. .....A paradise to be explored. .. The natural beauty is serene....do take extra clothes as u will get all wet if u take full tour.... Water is very clean... well maintained. ..fully recommended

title: Ok experience/ yet Fun
review: Local know as guchu pani is just a river cave formation.. i personall find it dirty so dnt felt like going till the end.. Local bus services are available up to Anarwala Village, from where it is a kilometre's trek away.. U have to walk a lot so personal vehicles is must

title: This place is mysterious & complete fun!
review: Wear floaters, capris, walk through the caves.. a unique experience! It's quite a drive away from the city, but very worthwhile.

title: Man Kind Destructs Everything It Sets Foot On
review: I first visited the Robber's cave around 8 years ago, when it wasn't as popular and crowded, and when it was a real getaway, with its fresh, clean water and the awe-striking pool at the end.

title: Natural Water slide at its best !!
review: Came to know of this place from a friend and then started to drive from Mussorie to Robbers cave. A 3 km stretch of road connects this place to the Dehradun-Mussorie road. Once on the road you feel like its going nowhere but at the end you see a Parking area with water flowing besides it.

title: Too much walking and then...... Wonder struck
review: I was excited when I was told that we will be visiting the Robbers cave in Dehradun.

title: Curious
review: Very busy place but great to wander through the rocks and water. Don't forget to take a change of clothes!

title: Excellent place..
review: Place is quite different from usual Tourist places. With knee deep cold water between high mountains give a very different feeling. Must watch place. Moreover its on the way from Dehradun to Mussoorie. Must carry clothes for changing after you had fun in water. Bathroom chappal's are readily available for Rs 10/- rent.

title: Do you really want to visit?
review: There is a parking fee of RS. 40 but is there any proper parking? There is an entry fee but is the place clean or maintained or with any facilities? No.

title: Natural Beauty
review: I visit this place in 2008 and in 2014. it was developed a lot.

title: As The Name suggests...
